 [![Skywalker and Shara Bey recovered the last fragments of the Great Tree from the Imperial research base on Vetine.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/9d/LukeSkywalkerSharaBey-ShatteredEmpire4.png/revision/latest?cb=20151031001727) [![Skywalker and Shara Bey recovered the last fragments of the Great Tree from the Imperial research base on Vetine.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/9d/LukeSkywalkerSharaBey-ShatteredEmpire4.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/258?cb=20151031001727)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/9d/LukeSkywalkerSharaBey-ShatteredEmpire4.png/revision/latest?cb=20151031001727) 

Skywalker and Shara Bey recovered the last fragments of the Great Tree from the Imperial research base on Vetine.

 

In [5 ABY](/wiki/5_ABY "5 ABY"),[[207]](#cite_note-Note-207) three [months](/wiki/Standard_month "Standard month") after the Battle of Endor, Skywalker planned a [mission](/wiki/Mission_to_Vetine "Mission to Vetine") to an [Imperial research base](/wiki/Imperial_base_(Vetine) "Imperial base (Vetine)") on the planet [Vetine](/wiki/Vetine "Vetine") in order to retrieve the last remaining fragment of a [Force-sensitive tree](/wiki/Great_Tree_(Coruscant) "Great Tree (Coruscant)"). The [tree](/wiki/Uneti_tree "Uneti tree"), which once dwelled in the heart of the Jedi Temple on Coruscant, was stolen by the Emperor after he came to power and converted the Jedi Temple into the Imperial Palace. Skywalker recruited Shara Bey to fly as his co-pilot on the mission, and, along with Artoo, they flew a stolen Imperial shuttle, *[Antarra](/wiki/Antarra "Antarra")*, to Vetine. While en route, Skywalker told Bey about the plan, including how she would pose as ISB Agent [Alecia Beck](/wiki/Alecia_Beck "Alecia Beck"), using codes obtained by Solo and the Pathfinders during a [raid](/wiki/Raid_at_the_Wretch_of_Tayron "Raid at the Wretch of Tayron") on an ISB base at the [Wretch](/wiki/Wretch_of_Tayron "Wretch of Tayron") of [Tayron](/wiki/Tayron "Tayron"). Upon their arrival, Bey claimed she was Agent Beck and that she had arrived to perform an unannounced inspection. The base's commander, [Commandant](/wiki/Commandant "Commandant") [Hurron](/wiki/Hurron "Hurron"), showed them into the facility and led them to the research lab containing the tree, at which point he revealed that he knew that Bey was not Beck. Hurron questioned why two Rebels would break into the facility, and Skywalker explained the importance of the tree—which he found had two remaining fragments. Skywalker and Bey fought their way out of the base, making their way through numerous stormtroopers who attempted to stop their escape. Once back at *Antarra*, Hurron ordered his forces to throw thermal detonators at the escaping Rebels, but Skywalker used the Force to deflect them back, killing Hurron and several of his stormtroopers in an explosion.[[206]](#cite_note-Shattered_Empire_4-206)

The Rebel trio made their way back towards the Alliance Fleet. During the trip back, Skywalker and Bey discussed the latter's future plans for service in the Rebellion, as Skywalker knew that Bey was considering leaving the Alliance to reunite with her husband, Pathfinder Sergeant Kes Dameron, and their son Poe. Bey was unsure as to whether she wanted to leave the Rebels behind, but Skywalker's guidance helped Bey decide to leave the Alliance. The Jedi Knight gifted one of the tree fragments to her, as he had only expected to find one, believing that the important relic would be kept safe with Bey and her family. She and Dameron planted it outside of their [new home](/wiki/Wetyin%27s_Colony "Wetyin's Colony") on Yavin 4.[[206]](#cite_note-Shattered_Empire_4-206)

#### War's end

:   "*He's* beautiful*, Leia--I'm so happy for you both...the three of you.*"  
    "*How does it feel to be an uncle, Luke? Maybe that'll keep you close and stop your wandering.*"
:   ―Luke Skywalker and Leia Organa discussing the birth of Ben[[208]](#cite_note-Last_Stand_4-208)

 [![Skywalker attended the signing of the Galactic Concordance between the Galactic Empire and the New Republic on Chandrila](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0a/GalacticConcordance-BattleOfJakkuLastStand4.png/revision/latest?cb=20250122143852) [![Skywalker attended the signing of the Galactic Concordance between the Galactic Empire and the New Republic on Chandrila](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0a/GalacticConcordance-BattleOfJakkuLastStand4.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20250122143852)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0a/GalacticConcordance-BattleOfJakkuLastStand4.png/revision/latest?cb=20250122143852) 

Skywalker attended the signing of the Galactic Concordance between the Galactic Empire and the New Republic on Chandrila

 

An [Imperial officer](/wiki/Unidentified_Imperial_gunner "Unidentified Imperial gunner") stationed on a Star Destroyer during the [Battle of Jakku](/wiki/Battle_of_Jakku "Battle of Jakku") claimed to have seen the Jedi Knight using the Force and a lightsaber to dispatch Star Destroyers in space, causing them to crash into the surface of the planet. When the Star Destroyer crashed into the surface the officer said he was recovered by a figure who dragged him across the desert searching wreckage for other survivors. He also noted the man wore clothes similar to Luke Skywalker and talked about being raised in another desert.[[209]](#cite_note-Legends-209) Skywalker was indeed at [Jakku](/wiki/Jakku "Jakku"), though he confronted [Ubrik Adelhard](/wiki/Ubrik_Adelhard "Ubrik Adelhard") aboard the [*Scepter*](/wiki/Scepter_(Imperial-class) "Scepter (Imperial-class)") and was not on the ground.[[208]](#cite_note-Last_Stand_4-208)

 [![Skywalker visited his family shortly after the birth of his nephew Ben.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/83/TheSkywalkerSoloFamily-BattleOfJakkuLastStand4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250123161257) [![Skywalker visited his family shortly after the birth of his nephew Ben.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/83/TheSkywalkerSoloFamily-BattleOfJakkuLastStand4.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20250123161257)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/83/TheSkywalkerSoloFamily-BattleOfJakkuLastStand4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250123161257) 

Skywalker visited his family shortly after the birth of his nephew Ben.

 

The Galactic Civil War came to a close with the signing of the [Galactic Concordance](/wiki/Galactic_Concordance "Galactic Concordance"), a peace treaty between the Republic and the Empire that forced it to remain within pre-established borders, though some of the remnants of the once-powerful military force disappeared into the [Unknown Regions](/wiki/Unknown_Regions "Unknown Regions").[[210]](#cite_note-TFA_VD-210) Skywalker, along with many other notable individuals witnessed the signing of the Concordance between Mas Amedda and Mon Mothma.[[208]](#cite_note-Last_Stand_4-208)

Following the signing of the treaty, Leia gave birth to her and Han's son and Luke's nephew, Ben Solo. Skywalker visited the family shortly after Ben's birth where Leia hoped that Skywalker being an uncle would keep him closer to home.[[208]](#cite_note-Last_Stand_4-208) There were rumors that Skywalker visited his sister and Han before disappearing on an untold mission. Others claimed that his absence was conspicuous.[[211]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-211)

### Rebuilding the Jedi Order

#### Training his sister

##### Becoming a teacher

:   "*You're going to make me a better teacher.*"  
    "*What do you mean?*"  
    "*Your footwork is terrible. Don't get me wrong, your lightsaber craft is coming along, but…you do other things. Naturally. What I mean is, you're exceptional. Just…different.*"
:   ―Skywalker and Organa during the latter's training[[212]](#cite_note-TROS:_Expanded_Edition-212)

 [![After the Battle of Endor, Skywalker's sister became his first apprentice.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/06/Luke-Leia-training.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200613205339) [![After the Battle of Endor, Skywalker's sister became his first apprentice.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/06/Luke-Leia-training.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200613205339)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/06/Luke-Leia-training.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200613205339) 

After the Battle of Endor, Skywalker's sister became his first apprentice.

 

Some time after the Battle of Endor, Skywalker took on his first student and trained his twin sister in the ways of the Force. At the latter's suggestion the two of them trained together on [Ajan Kloss](/wiki/Ajan_Kloss "Ajan Kloss"). Under his tutelage, Organa constructed [her lightsaber](/wiki/Leia%27s_lightsaber "Leia's lightsaber"), and began to learn the principles of lightsaber combat. Skywalker also instructed in her in the basics of the Force, teaching her about light side, and in meditation. He was impressed by Organa's strength in the Force and how quickly she progressed in her training. While training her, he found it interesting that she struggled with skills and concepts that he had a natural affinity for (like lightsaber combat), but excelled in other areas (like meditation) that were harder for him to master. He would use various tools to help Organa develop her senses, such as a repurposed [KSE-H44 A-wing pilot helmet](/wiki/KSE-H44_A-wing_pilot_helmet "KSE-H44 A-wing pilot helmet") and marksman-H combat training remotes.[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4)

At some point during their training together, Skywalker and Organa spent an hour sparring with their lightsabers. Later that same day, Skywalker attempted to teach her in a scenario similar to what he did with Yoda on Dagobah, where she held herself up in a handstand with the Force.[[212]](#cite_note-TROS:_Expanded_Edition-212) At another point, Skywalker explained from personal experience that the Force allowed glimpses of the future, past, and at times, departed, and that these voices would offer her guidance from beyond death in times of hardship.[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4)

##### The Archivist's Holocron

:   "*Here. I'll activate it for you.*"  
    "*This doesn't look like the other ones.*"  
    "*Well it's definitely a holocron of some kind, but I've never seen another like it. It responds to…well. You'll see it'll answer your questions though. I know it did for me.*"
:   ―Skywalker and Organa on the Archivist's Holocron[[173]](#cite_note-Hidden_Empire_5-173)

Sometime during Organa's training, the two discovered[[173]](#cite_note-Hidden_Empire_5-173) a [holocron](/wiki/The_Archivist%27s_Holocron "The Archivist's Holocron") that contained the story of Lady [Qi'ra](/wiki/Qi%27ra "Qi'ra"), the former leader of Crimson Dawn, and her [war against the Sith](/wiki/War_against_the_Sith "War against the Sith") that she had carried out between 3 ABY and 4 ABY shortly before the fall of the Empire. Skywalker had listened to it beforehand and it had answered his questions, so he activated wit for Organa using the light side of the Force. He agreed with Organa that it was unusual for a holocron despite definitely being one, telling her she would see why and assuring her it would answer her questions.[[213]](#cite_note-Crimson_Reign_1-213) As the Archivist described Qi'ra's plans to kill Vader and Palpatine, Skywalker lamented that Qi'ra had never come to them for help and instead kept everything secret and did it by herself. Organa suggested it was because Qi'ra was not trusting.[[214]](#cite_note-Hidden_Empire_1-214) The Archivist suggested that the Rebel Alliance had perhaps been engineered by Palpatine, which Skywalker said the Archivist at at lest gotten wrong, but Organa pointed out that while he did not create it, he definitely used it.[[171]](#cite_note-Hidden_Empire_2-171) When she described the presence of Darth Vader as feeling like you were in the presence of an animal eating its own young, Skywalker held onto that idea and repeated it out loud.[[215]](#cite_note-Hidden_Empire_3-215)

 [![Skywalker and Organa with the Archivist's Holocron](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ad/LukeAndLeiaHolocron-HiddenEmpire5.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230821020057) [![Skywalker and Organa with the Archivist's Holocron](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ad/LukeAndLeiaHolocron-HiddenEmpire5.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230821020057)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ad/LukeAndLeiaHolocron-HiddenEmpire5.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230821020057) 

Skywalker and Organa with the Archivist's Holocron

 

At the end of the story, the Archivist said that Qi'ra had failed to take down the Sith and saw her hidden empire of Crimson Dawn destroyed, even theorizing that Qi'ra had been killed by the Empire or its [remnants](/wiki/Imperial_Remnants "Imperial Remnants") as she had never seen her again. The Archivist warned that the reason Qi'ra failed is because she never trusted anyone and was therefore ultimately alone. Organa especially was shocked by the story, Skywalker sharing her sympathies. He told Organa that the Archivist had been wrong, however, in saying that Qi'ra had failed to take down the Sith and the Empire, as Crimson Dawn agents had been the ones that revealed the existence of the second Death star to the rebellion, Leia adding that Qi'ra's syndicate war had allowed the Rebellion to regroup by distracting Palpatine. Skywalker postulated that because nothing happens in a vacuum, Qi'ra had touched the galaxy and saved it from the Sith, just not in the way she thought. Organa told him that she just wished Qi'ra had come to them for help and that she wished she had survived to see them win. Unbeknownst to them, however, Qi'ra had survived.[[173]](#cite_note-Hidden_Empire_5-173)

##### Leia's final training session

:   "*It was the last night of her training. Leia told me that she had sensed the death of her son at the end of her Jedi path. She surrendered her saber to me and said one day it would be picked up again by someone who would finish her journey.*"
:   ―Luke Skywalker, to Rey[[17]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-17)

On the final night of her training, Organa experienced a dark vision that her Jedi path would lead to the death of her [son](/wiki/Ben_Solo "Ben Solo").[[17]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-17) Realizing where the galaxy needed her most,[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4) she set aside her lightsaber[[17]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-17) to focus on her new family and [senatorial](/wiki/New_Republic_Senate "New Republic Senate") duties.[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4) While Skywalker hoped that his sister would resume her training later on, Organa gave him her lightsaber to convince him otherwise, asking to pass it on to a promising student someday. However, Skywalker did not do that and never told her where he stored her lightsaber.[[212]](#cite_note-TROS:_Expanded_Edition-212)

#### Quest for knowledge

:   "*I had great hope for the future of the Jedi. I came to believe that if a single Jedi could help bring balance back to the Force, then perhaps a restored Jedi Order could maintain peace and prevent the dark side from ever regaining its hold on the galaxy. So I scoured worlds for the remaining Jedi texts and gathered a new class of apprentices under my tutelage.*"
:   ―Luke Skywalker[[216]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Jedi-216)

 [![Skywalker and R2-D2 searched out Jedi lore together.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/29/LukeSearchForJediStuff-Timelines.png/revision/latest?cb=20240914025303) [![Skywalker and R2-D2 searched out Jedi lore together.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/29/LukeSearchForJediStuff-Timelines.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20240914025303)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/29/LukeSearchForJediStuff-Timelines.png/revision/latest?cb=20240914025303) 

Skywalker and R2-D2 searched out Jedi lore together.

 

With the Empire fallen and the Sith seamlessly vanquished, Skywalker had great hope for the future of the Jedi. He believed if a single Jedi could bring balance to the Force as his father had done, then a revived Jedi Order could keep the peace and prevent the dark side from ever returning to such strength.[[216]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Jedi-216)

Just as he promised Farnay near the start of his own Jedi studies,[[48]](#cite_note-weapon-jedi-48) in 5 ABY,[[217]](#cite_note-Luke_lore_date-217) Skywalker set about rebuilding the Jedi Order. Despite his optimism, he had many unanswered questions[[218]](#cite_note-TLJ_VD-218) and was hesitant to take on another apprentice after his sister Leia, unsure of his grounding in Jedi lore.[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4) Instead, Skywalker largely disappeared from galactic view and dedicated himself to traveling the galaxy in hopes of finding what remained of the Jedi after the Empire's long efforts to eradicate their history. Through his quest, he came to understand much about himself and his destiny and gained the confidence he needed to rebuild the Jedi Order.[[218]](#cite_note-TLJ_VD-218) Luke, being the last Jedi, became a caretaker of the Jedi Order's legacy. As he traveled the galaxy, he also searched for force-sensitives who could possibly become his students.[[219]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_Book-219)

 [![Luke Skywalker visited many places in search of Jedi lore, including Elphrona.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f5/Elphrona-TheRiseOfKyloRen2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200108200611) [![Luke Skywalker visited many places in search of Jedi lore, including Elphrona.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f5/Elphrona-TheRiseOfKyloRen2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200108200611)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f5/Elphrona-TheRiseOfKyloRen2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200108200611) 

Luke Skywalker visited many places in search of Jedi lore, including Elphrona.

 

Skywalker's research into the Jedi was a long and difficult task that took him years.[[218]](#cite_note-TLJ_VD-218) He was aided by [Lor San Tekka](/wiki/Lor_San_Tekka "Lor San Tekka"), an explorer and member of the [Church of the Force](/wiki/Church_of_the_Force "Church of the Force")[[220]](#cite_note-San_Tekka_DB-220) who, though not Force-sensitive himself, believed in the Jedi ideals. San Tekka was old enough to remember the Jedi Knights before the Clone Wars, and he did not believe the Emperor's lies about how the Jedi betrayed the Old Republic.[[210]](#cite_note-TFA_VD-210) San Tekka, who believed that the return of the Jedi Order was essential to bring balance to the Force,[[8]](#cite_note-Episode_VII-8) became a valuable ally for both Skywalker and Organa.[[210]](#cite_note-TFA_VD-210)

[Gatalenta](/wiki/Gatalenta "Gatalenta") was one of the first destinations in Skywalker's search,[[221]](#cite_note-Bloodline-221) and he also traveled to Moraband,[[222]](#cite_note-The_Dark_Side-222) the ancient home of the Sith,[[21]](#cite_note-Destiny-21) to investigate anything he could about the Force.[[222]](#cite_note-The_Dark_Side-222) He visited the [Deep Core](/wiki/Deep_Core "Deep Core") planet of [Tython](/wiki/Tython "Tython") many times and studied its ancient [ruined temple](/wiki/Force-henge "Force-henge"), impressed by the majesty of the site every time he visited.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7) He scoured many worlds and assembled a collection of eight ancient bound [books](/wiki/Book "Book")[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4) and scrolls[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) that described Jedi tenets, history and guidance for those following the path of the Jedi—[sacred Jedi texts](/wiki/Sacred_Jedi_texts "Sacred Jedi texts"). One of the books was the *[Rammahgon](/wiki/Rammahgon "Rammahgon")*, an influential work that was thought destroyed over 5,000 years ago but retrieved by Skywalker while he explored the subterranean ruins of [Ossus](/wiki/Ossus "Ossus"). The *[Aionomica](/wiki/Aionomica "Aionomica")* was another, a two-volume collection of Jedi explorations and codifications of the Force, part codex, correspondence and scrapbook.[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4) He also found a book that was a catalog of the [Eeshaypher Collection](/wiki/Eeshaypher_Collection "Eeshaypher Collection"), a forbidden gallery of artifacts related to the dark side of the Force.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7) At one point, Skywalker journeyed to [Black Spire Outpost](/wiki/Black_Spire_Outpost "Black Spire Outpost") on [Batuu](/wiki/Batuu "Batuu"), searching for ancient Jedi texts and artifacts.[[223]](#cite_note-Galaxy's_Edge-223)

 [![Skywalker uncovered the Aionomica and other Jedi relics on his travels.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/27/Aionomica.png/revision/latest?cb=20191228142829) [![Skywalker uncovered the Aionomica and other Jedi relics on his travels.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/27/Aionomica.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20191228142829)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/27/Aionomica.png/revision/latest?cb=20191228142829) 

Skywalker uncovered the *Aionomica* and other Jedi relics on his travels.

 

Skywalker dedicated much of these years to finding the site of the [first Jedi Temple](/wiki/First_Jedi_Temple "First Jedi Temple"). He uncovered many tantalizing clues that hinted at the origins of the Jedi, but the precise location was a mystery. One key to unravelling the mystery was his study of the spread of the Force-sensitive uneti saplings.[[218]](#cite_note-TLJ_VD-218) He also made use of the [Jedi star compass](/wiki/Jedi_star_compass "Jedi star compass") he had discovered in the Emperor's storehouse on Pillio. With a [plasma](/wiki/Plasma "Plasma")-encased [supraluminite](/wiki/Supraluminite "Supraluminite") [lodestone](/wiki/Lodestone "Lodestone") at its center, the compass functioned much like the ancient [wayfinders](/wiki/Wayfinder "Wayfinder") and was attuned to specific points in hyperspace. Through studying the compass, Skywalker uncovered a path to Ahch-To the site of [Temple Island](/wiki/Temple_Island "Temple Island") and the first Jedi Temple.[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4) With the help of Lor San Tekka, he finally put together the many clues and learned the location of the temple, a discovery that he and San Tekka kept a secret.[[218]](#cite_note-TLJ_VD-218)

With San Tekka, Skywalker hunted down relics the force across the stars. Following the Jedi compass he recovered on Pillio, the pair mapped out the network of Jedi temples scattered across the galaxy, many of which were forgotten after the end of the Jedi Purge. Their voyages proved fruitful most of the time, Skywalker amassing a massive collection of tomes, texts, scrolls, data cards, ritual items, sigils, and other antique symbols. Besides the Jedi star compass, Skywalker also acquired lightsabers. All of this, the pair of men researched, gaining even deeper understanding of the old Jedi Order and its teachings.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

 [![Skywalker discovered the lost cache of Jedi artifacts belonging to Jocastu Nu.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/10/LukeDiscoversJocastasCache-2017DarthVader10.png/revision/latest?cb=20220203052115) [![Skywalker discovered the lost cache of Jedi artifacts belonging to Jocastu Nu.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/10/LukeDiscoversJocastasCache-2017DarthVader10.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220203052115)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/10/LukeDiscoversJocastasCache-2017DarthVader10.png/revision/latest?cb=20220203052115) 

Skywalker discovered the lost cache of Jedi artifacts belonging to Jocastu Nu.

 

Around [6 ABY](/wiki/6_ABY "6 ABY"),[[3]](#cite_note-Timelines-3) in his explorations for Jedi lore, Skywalker discovered the [cache](/wiki/Jocasta_Nu%27s_cache "Jocasta Nu's cache") of Jedi [Chief Librarian](/wiki/Chief_Librarian "Chief Librarian") [Jocasta Nu](/wiki/Jocasta_Nu "Jocasta Nu"),[[224]](#cite_note-DLOTS-224) and recovered her holocrons, which contained a wealth of Jedi knowledge and history.[[219]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_Book-219) He uncovered many lost Jedi and Force relics throughout the galaxy, including a [Jedi Crusader pendant](/wiki/Jedi_Crusader_pendant "Jedi Crusader pendant"),[[218]](#cite_note-TLJ_VD-218) and another Holocron, of the High Republic Era Jedi [Avar Kriss](/wiki/Avar_Kriss "Avar Kriss").[[225]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_3-225)

He came to learn about some of the Jedi Masters that existed before the fall of the Order, such as [Mace Windu](/wiki/Mace_Windu "Mace Windu"), [Qui-Gon Jinn](/wiki/Qui-Gon_Jinn "Qui-Gon Jinn"), and Jocasta Nu. Skywalker also learned about the [Midi-chlorians](/wiki/Midi-chlorian "Midi-chlorian"), the [Jedi Code](/wiki/Jedi_Code "Jedi Code"), and about the different Jedi Temples that existed, such as the Lothal Jedi Temple. Luke as well as learning about the light, he also learned about the Dark Side. Luke learned about several Sith Lords and dark side warriors such as Darth Bane, Darth Maul, [Darth Tyranus](/wiki/Dooku "Dooku"), and the Inquisitorius Jedi hunters of the Galactic Empire and about several locations and temples strong with the Dark Side such as his father's castle [Fortress Vader](/wiki/Fortress_Vader "Fortress Vader") on Mustafar. With all this, he also learned about the Sith's history and several events, such as the creation of Darth Bane's Rule of Two, and the Scourge of Malachor.[[216]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Jedi-216)

Another relic he recovered was a page of the [Journal of Caleb Dume](/wiki/Journal_of_Caleb_Dume "Journal of Caleb Dume"), a survivor of the Jedi Purge who took on the new name Kanan Jarrus, fought against the Empire, and trained his own apprentice, [Ezra Bridger](/wiki/Ezra_Bridger "Ezra Bridger"), in the years of Skywalker's own youth on Tatooine.[[216]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Jedi-216) He eventually brought this and the other Jedi artifacts he had uncovered to Ahch-To and compiled his knowledge of the Jedi into a book he called *[The Secrets of the Jedi](/wiki/The_Secrets_of_the_Jedi "The Secrets of the Jedi")*. Ahch-To was also where Skywalker collected the *Rammahgon*, the *Aionomica*, the *[Chronicles of Brus-bu](/wiki/Chronicles_of_Brus-bu "Chronicles of Brus-bu")*, [Poetics of a Jedi](/wiki/Poetics_of_a_Jedi "Poetics of a Jedi"), and the other sacred Jedi texts[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4) and assembled them into a small [library](/wiki/Library "Library") housed in an [uneti tree](/wiki/Tree_library "Tree library").[[226]](#cite_note-Ahch-To_Library-226)

#### Rescue of Grogu

:   "*He is strong with the Force, but talent without training is nothing. I will give my life to protect the Child… but he will not be safe until he masters his abilities.*"
:   ―Luke Skywalker, to Din Djarin[[18]](#cite_note-Chapter_16-18)

 [![Luke Skywalker takes Grogu as his student.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/4e/Luke_and_Grogu_-_Mando_Chapter_16.png/revision/latest?cb=20201219072424) [![Luke Skywalker takes Grogu as his student.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/4e/Luke_and_Grogu_-_Mando_Chapter_16.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/305?cb=20201219072424)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/4e/Luke_and_Grogu_-_Mando_Chapter_16.png/revision/latest?cb=20201219072424) 

Luke Skywalker takes Grogu as his student.

 

In approximately [9 ABY](/wiki/9_ABY "9 ABY"),[[3]](#cite_note-Timelines-3) a [Force-sensitive](/wiki/Force-sensitive "Force-sensitive") member of [Yoda's species](/wiki/Yoda%27s_species "Yoda's species") named [Grogu](/wiki/Din_Grogu "Din Grogu") reached out in the Force from the [seeing stone](/wiki/Seeing_stone "Seeing stone") on Tython. Grogu had been raised at the [Jedi Temple](/wiki/Imperial_Palace "Imperial Palace") on Coruscant before the [Great Jedi Purge](/wiki/Great_Jedi_Purge "Great Jedi Purge") but had not yet been fully trained as a Jedi,[[227]](#cite_note-Chapter_13-227) and had since become a [foundling](/wiki/Foundling "Foundling") cared for by the [Mandalorian](/wiki/Mandalorian "Mandalorian") bounty hunter [Din Djarin](/wiki/Din_Djarin "Din Djarin"), whom had been tasked with taking Grogu to someone who could train him in the use of the Force.[[18]](#cite_note-Chapter_16-18)

Shortly afterwards, Grogu was [taken](/wiki/Battle_of_Tython_(9_ABY) "Battle of Tython (9 ABY)") by an [Imperial remnant](/wiki/Gideon%27s_Imperial_remnant "Gideon's Imperial remnant").[[18]](#cite_note-Chapter_16-18) Feeling a presence in the Force,[[228]](#cite_note-Character_Encyclopedia_Updated_and_Expanded-228) Skywalker tracked Grogu to a [light cruiser](/wiki/Gideon%27s_light_cruiser "Gideon's light cruiser") that Djarin and his allies had boarded in [their own efforts](/wiki/Second_rescue_of_Grogu "Second rescue of Grogu") to rescue him. Skywalker boarded the vessel with R2-D2 and defeated a [platoon](/wiki/Platoon "Platoon") of [third-generation dark troopers](/wiki/Phase-III_Dark_Trooper "Phase-III Dark Trooper") that had trapped Grogu and Djarin's team on the ship's bridge. Afterwards, Skywalker offered his hand to Grogu, and, noting the child's strong attachment to Djarin, told Djarin that he would take care of him if Djarin allowed it. Djarin relinquished Grogu to Skywalker to be trained in the ways of the Force and Skywalker left the ship with the child.[[18]](#cite_note-Chapter_16-18)

#### Building an academy

:   "*You've taught him well.*"  
    "*It's more like he's remembering than I'm actually teaching him anything.*"  
    "*Sometimes the student guides the master.*"  
    [...]"*Sometimes I wonder if his heart is in it [...] What should I do about him?*"  
    "*Trust your instincts.*"
:   ―Luke Skywalker and Ahsoka Tano on Grogu's training[[229]](#cite_note-Comes_a_Stranger-229)

 [![Skywalker instructing Grogu on Ossus.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/94/FrogLift-BoBFCE.png/revision/latest?cb=20230814044205) [![Skywalker instructing Grogu on Ossus.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/94/FrogLift-BoBFCE.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20230814044205)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/94/FrogLift-BoBFCE.png/revision/latest?cb=20230814044205) 

Skywalker instructing Grogu on Ossus.

 

Fulfilling the dying wish of Yoda,[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-12) Skywalker set out to begin training a new generation of Jedi. Having rescued and brought in an original Jedi Padawan from the twilight years of the Galactic Republic, Skywalker ventured to Ossus with the young Grogu to build the first [Jedi Academy](/wiki/Jedi_Temple_of_Luke_Skywalker "Jedi Temple of Luke Skywalker") after the Jedi Order's near extinction following Order 66. Possessing the wisdom and teachings of his own masters, Skywalker tried to educate his young student through the ways of the Force. Telling tales of Master Yoda onto Grogu, the young Jedi Master passed on what he had learned, echoing Yoda's words "size matters not" and to do, not try. However, Skywalker strived to make impression on his small student, having to stop him from using the Force to eat creatures and let Grogu use the Force as he did. Knowing that knowledge lied in Grogu's memory, Luke offered to help him remember and placed his hands gently on the alien's head. Seeing the traumatic images of the 501st Legion gunning down three Jedi Knights protecting the Padawan, everything faded to black when the clones killed the Jedi and moved towards Grogu. When his student awoke, Luke greeted his return and began to better understand the turmoil and subsequent reluctance of Grogu towards his lessons.[[229]](#cite_note-Comes_a_Stranger-229)

 [![Skywalker speaks with Tano about Grogu, while watching him train on the riverbank.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/ba/TanoandSkywalker.png/revision/latest?cb=20220203041739) [![Skywalker speaks with Tano about Grogu, while watching him train on the riverbank.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/ba/TanoandSkywalker.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/275?cb=20220203041739)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/ba/TanoandSkywalker.png/revision/latest?cb=20220203041739) 

Skywalker speaks with Tano about Grogu, while watching him train on the riverbank.

 

While carrying Grogu on his back as he had done with Yoda on Dagobah, Skywalker felt the presence of the Mandalorian, Din Djarin. After a time, Grogu seemed to master balance and studied in awe as Luke practiced his skills with the lightsaber. Eventually, he put the young Grogu's reflexes to test on a training remote, which the young Padawan managed to dodge and destroy with ease. [Ahsoka Tano](/wiki/Ahsoka_Tano "Ahsoka Tano") approached Skywalker and complimented him on his progress with Grogu. The doubtful Jedi expressed his concerns that Grogu's progress was due to him gradually remembering his training on Coruscant, not necessarily his training so far with him. Ahsoka stated that sometimes the student teaches the master. Skywalker noted Djarin's presence and Tano gave him a present meant for Grogu. Not sure whether Grogu had heart for the way of the Jedi, Skywalker shared his thoughts. Fortunately, Tano knew the same mind of Skywalker's father, seeing that same compassionate heart which she felt Anakin had for her and mentioned Luke's alikeness. Skywalker asked what should be done and Tano told him to trust his instincts, wisdom she learned from her master. She then departed the planet and said the two would perhaps meet again and told the Force be with him.[[229]](#cite_note-Comes_a_Stranger-229)

 [![Skywalker showing Grogu Master Yoda's old lightsaber](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ac/LukeYodasSecondLightsaber-FromTheDesertComesAStranger.png/revision/latest?cb=20220203035839) [![Skywalker showing Grogu Master Yoda's old lightsaber](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ac/LukeYodasSecondLightsaber-FromTheDesertComesAStranger.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/282?cb=20220203035839)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ac/LukeYodasSecondLightsaber-FromTheDesertComesAStranger.png/revision/latest?cb=20220203035839) 

Skywalker showing Grogu Master Yoda's old lightsaber

 

Heeding the advice of Tano, Skywalker decided to offer Grogu a final choice. In the stone hut, Skywalker presented Grogu with Din Djarin's gift as well as the lightsaber of Master Yoda, which Skywalker had kept. The first path was to accept the present from Djarin and be returned to him, however, by choosing attachment he would forsake the Jedi way. The second was to pick up [Yoda's lightsaber](/wiki/Yoda%27s_second_lightsaber "Yoda's second lightsaber") and pledge himself to Luke's teachings to become his first Jedi Padawan. He told Grogu that to become a Jedi would take years and hard work, though at the end he could be a great Jedi. He then let Grogu choose.[[229]](#cite_note-Comes_a_Stranger-229)

Grogu would choose the armor, thus leading Skywalker to put him in his X-wing starfighter and instruct R2-D2 to pilot him to Tatooine to be reunited with Djarin.[[230]](#cite_note-In_the_Name_of_Honor-230) Despite their time together being brief, Skywalker's guidance had a significant impact on Grogu. After being asked about Grogu's impressive use of the Force by fellow Mandalorian [Bo-Katan Kryze](/wiki/Bo-Katan_Kryze "Bo-Katan Kryze"), Djarin noted that his abilities were a result of Skywalker's training.[[231]](#cite_note-Chapter_20-231)

Some time after his meeting with Ahsoka Tano, the [Nightsister](/wiki/Nightsisters "Nightsisters") [Morgan Elsbeth](/wiki/Morgan_Elsbeth "Morgan Elsbeth") recruited former Jedi Knight of the old Jedi Order [Baylan Skoll](/wiki/Baylan_Skoll "Baylan Skoll"), who was aware of the truth behind Skywalker's father, to help locate Imperial [Grand Admiral](/wiki/Grand_Admiral "Grand Admiral") [Thrawn](/wiki/Mitth%27raw%27nuruodo "Mitth'raw'nuruodo"). As Skywalker had become prominent during the Galactic Civil War, Skoll became aware of his existence, and kept his name, alongside the names of other Rebel heroes, listed in a device on his gauntlet during the search for the planet [Peridea](/wiki/Peridea "Peridea") in a [distant galaxy](/wiki/Far_galaxy "Far galaxy").[[232]](#cite_note-Part_Two-232)

#### Recruiting his nephew

:   "*He's an amazing teacher. Very strong. I've learned so much from him…*"
:   ―Ben Solo, on his uncle[[233]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_2-233)

 [![Skywalker and Solo together](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/06/Luke_and_Ben.png/revision/latest?cb=20220627024734) [![Skywalker and Solo together](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/06/Luke_and_Ben.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20220627024734)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/06/Luke_and_Ben.png/revision/latest?cb=20220627024734) 

Skywalker and Solo together

 

Though reluctant to take on another apprentice at first, when the Force awakened in Skywalker's nephew Ben Solo[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4) and his mother Leia could see the dark side taking hold of her son, she entrusted the boy to her brother to help him find balance.[[216]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Jedi-216) He agreed to train the 10-year-old Solo,[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4) in [15 ABY](/wiki/15_ABY "15 ABY").[[234]](#cite_note-Training_Ben_Solo_year-234) Skywalker took on the responsibilities of a Jedi Master by teaching his nephew. After Ben's fall to the dark side however, Luke would say that he was merely playing the role of Jedi Master as it was a title he had not formally earned.[[216]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Jedi-216)

Skywalker taught Solo the ways of the Jedi, in its many forms, under the tutelage and impressed on his pupil the importance of practicing discipline and control. Solo gave his best efforts to gain his Master's approval, although at times their familial bond caused him to address Skywalker as uncle instead of Master.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7) Though he loved his nephew,[[235]](#cite_note-TLC-235) Skywalker had committed his life to reestablishing the Jedi Order's teachings, which had virtually nothing to do with family ties; therefore, he taught Solo that detachment and distance were necessary to gaining the pure focus that every Jedi aspired to achieve.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

His nephew soon joined in exploring the galaxy for ancient Jedi lore,[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4) and together they found holocrons from forgotten eras and ancient Jedi texts with arcane writings.[[197]](#cite_note-S:AFaW-197) The two shared more than the same Skywalker blood, for like him, Ben gained a strong devotion to the ways of the Jedi Order.[[216]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Jedi-216) Skywalker saw his nephew's raw power and believed he could pass on his strengths to him,[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) and he attempted to manage his progress through the Force by having him exercise a level of restraint.[[236]](#cite_note-TROS:_A_Junior_Novel-236) Solo was his strongest and most prized student,[[20]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_1-20) and Skywalker went on to place his hope for the Jedi Order's future within his nephew,[[216]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Jedi-216) and despite knowing of the darkness within his pupil, the Jedi Master believed he was strong enough to keep it in check.[[218]](#cite_note-TLJ_VD-218)

Skywalker was a kind master,[[219]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_Book-219) and Solo considered his uncle to be a strong and amazing teacher,[[233]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_2-233) but Skywalker made mistakes that culminated over time, protecting Ben from the dark truths of their family, much like his sister did before him, and inadvertently isolated Ben over the years of his training.[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4) At the request of his sister, Luke never provided his nephew with the details of Anakin Skywalker's fall to the dark side or Darth Vader's redemption and return to the light.[[197]](#cite_note-S:AFaW-197)

During his training of his nephew, a powerful dark side-practitioner known as [Snoke](/wiki/Snoke "Snoke"),[[233]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_2-233) who was the [Supreme Leader](/wiki/Supreme_Leader "Supreme Leader") of a splinter group of the Empire known as the [First Order](/wiki/First_Order "First Order"), and also secretly a puppet of the resurrected Emperor Palpatine,[[17]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-17) began influencing Ben from afar, clouding him with the dark side.[[233]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_2-233) At some point Skywalker had encountered Snoke and supposedly damaged him,[[20]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_1-20) and Snoke was responsible for indirectly inspiring Luke to rebuild the Jedi Order, having tried to shatter his resolve.[[218]](#cite_note-TLJ_VD-218)

#### More apprentices

:   "*We all studied together. I was first, but they came not long after.*"
:   ―Ben Solo, on Luke's training other apprentices[[225]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_3-225)

 [![Skywalker training a new generation of Jedi](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e9/LukeTeachingJedi-TheRiseOfKyloRen3.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250306232725) [![Skywalker training a new generation of Jedi](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e9/LukeTeachingJedi-TheRiseOfKyloRen3.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20250306232725)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e9/LukeTeachingJedi-TheRiseOfKyloRen3.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250306232725) 

Skywalker training a new generation of Jedi

 

Around [16 ABY](/wiki/16_ABY "16 ABY"),[[3]](#cite_note-Timelines-3) Skywalker gathered disciples, young force-sensitive beings adrift with no way to harness their abilities as a result the Jedi Purge,[[197]](#cite_note-S:AFaW-197) who went on to be his first students.[[218]](#cite_note-TLJ_VD-218) Skywalker's new students numbered about a dozen besides his nephew,[[210]](#cite_note-TFA_VD-210) including students [Voe](/wiki/Voe "Voe"), [Tai](/wiki/Tai "Tai"), and [Hennix](/wiki/Hennix "Hennix"),[[20]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_1-20) and he worked to teach them everything he had learned in his own training and about the light side of the Force per Yoda's command.[[237]](#cite_note-USW,NE-237)

Skywalker hoped that teaching the students in a real Jedi Temple would offer them a more traditional Jedi path than his own training under Obi-Wan Kenobi and Yoda. He kept temple's location on Ossus a secret known only to the members of the Order and his loyal droid R2-D2.[[218]](#cite_note-TLJ_VD-218) Skywalker stored the recovered Jedi knowledge and relics that he and Lor San Tekka had recovered within the Jedi Temple,[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7) a decision which Solo disagreed, which he believed was just locked up and never used.[[233]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_2-233)

With the small gathering of his new students looking to him as a spiritual guide and mentor for the Jedi arts, Skywalker believed he could usher in a new era of enlightenment.[[197]](#cite_note-S:AFaW-197) With his attention now split between several other apprentices, Skywalker's nephew Ben Solo's focus was drawn away to dark Force knowledge.[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4) Teaching several Jedi techniques and traditions as telekinesis, meditation, and the use and construction of [lightsabers](/wiki/Lightsaber "Lightsaber"),[[225]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_3-225) Skywalker's approach for guiding the young minds under his care was steeped in his own master Yoda's teachings passed on while he was on Dagobah, so would often be preaching about patience and balance.[[197]](#cite_note-S:AFaW-197)

While also instilling the belief that all beings were equal within the Force,[[197]](#cite_note-S:AFaW-197) he gave lectures outside his temple, passing on ever more experience from training with Yoda on Dagobah as he taught the levitation of rocks through the Force. During one such event, student Voe asked why Ben Solo was stronger, where Skywalker compared the Force to a door, that it would become easier to use the more she opened herself up to it. The Jedi Master also tutored Hennix in opening holocrons through the Force, reminding the young [Quarren](/wiki/Quarren "Quarren") to listen to the unique voices of each holocron, for each one was different based on their teachings.[[225]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_3-225)

Skywalker desired heavily to preserve the teachings of the Jedi Order, laboring to pass on the best of what Yoda and Obi-Wan taught him as Jedi mentors at his Jedi temple and to instill the core beliefs they embodied within the next generation. Additionally, Luke understood what Yoda experienced with himself on Dagobah as teacher, having the same unique frustrations with his own pupils; a master guiding a young unseasoned student that was convinced they were wasting time on pointless exercises, such as stacking stones.[[197]](#cite_note-S:AFaW-197) At some point during his time as a Jedi Master, Skywalker would face a group of [IG-RM assassin droids](/wiki/IG-RM_bodyguard_and_enforcer_droid "IG-RM bodyguard and enforcer droid") alongside his nephew.[[238]](#cite_note-LoV_10-238)

#### Encountering the Knights of Ren

:   "*Well, hello there. Everything here is ours. We're going to take it…but* how *we take it is up to you. Your call, friends.*"  
    "*You're wrong. So, so wrong. This is a* Jedi outpost*. Everything in it belongs to the Jedi Order, which, at the moment, means me. I am the last Jedi.*"
:   ―Ren and Skywalker[[233]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_2-233)

 [![Skywalker, Solo, and San Tekka discover the Jedi Outpost on Elphrona.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f5/Elphrona-TheRiseOfKyloRen2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200108200611) [![Skywalker, Solo, and San Tekka discover the Jedi Outpost on Elphrona.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f5/Elphrona-TheRiseOfKyloRen2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200108200611)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f5/Elphrona-TheRiseOfKyloRen2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200108200611) 

Skywalker, Solo, and San Tekka discover the Jedi Outpost on Elphrona.

 

In [19 ABY](/wiki/19_ABY "19 ABY"), the year his nephew turned fourteen,[[197]](#cite_note-S:AFaW-197) Skywalker, Ben, and Lor San Tekka [traveled](/wiki/Mission_to_Elphrona "Mission to Elphrona") to a [Jedi outpost](/wiki/Elphrona_Outpost "Elphrona Outpost") on [Elphrona](/wiki/Elphrona "Elphrona"), a location from the days of the High Republic Era, hoping to find Jedi artifacts. Luke flew the ship and conversed with San Tekka, while Solo, without his master's knowledge, was communing with Snoke. Skywalker was initially skeptical of a Jedi presence so far from the core, but San Tekka assured him that with his expertise he had recognized the description from his contact as a Jedi Outpost, and explained that the Jedi's activity was greatly expanded throughout the galaxy during the High Republic Era. Meanwhile, Solo telepathically communicated with Snoke, expressing that he was tired of missions to find artifacts with Skywalker that he would just lock away in the temple and never use. Solo admitted that Skywalker was an amazing teacher, but was frustrated that he never wanted Solo to use any of the things he had taught him, which Snoke claimed was because Skywalker viewed Solo as a child and had not realized his true capabilities. Skywalker then told Solo that they would possibly find insights into the old Jedi, and added that they could find interesting weapons, as he knew that Solo was interested in such subjects, which San Tekka affirmed. Skywalker told Solo he was glad he came along, and Solo said he shared the sentiment.[[233]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_2-233)

When they landed, Skywalker was impressed by the sight of the outpost. He cautioned his apprentice to careful and warned that such a place was likely to be rigged with traps, recalling a time he found a lightsaber in a similar place that turned out to be a trap and nearly killed him. Inside, they found a treasure trove that Skywalker judged so impressive he thought it may be better than Jocasta Nu's cache, including many Jedi holocrons and a [lightsaber rifle](/wiki/Lightsaber_rifle "Lightsaber rifle"). Skywalker was excited by the possibility of learning many new things. As the three perused the outpost, instantly, both Skywalker and Solo felt a cold presence within the structure. They were then confronted by a group of dark side warriors known as the [Knights of Ren](/wiki/Knights_of_Ren "Knights of Ren") revealed themselves.[[233]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_2-233)

 [![Luke battles the Knights of Ren](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6a/OnlyOneMan-TheRiseOfKyloRen2.png/revision/latest?cb=20231124153316) [![Luke battles the Knights of Ren](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6a/OnlyOneMan-TheRiseOfKyloRen2.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/210?cb=20231124153316)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6a/OnlyOneMan-TheRiseOfKyloRen2.png/revision/latest?cb=20231124153316) 

Luke battles the Knights of Ren

 

Their master, "[Ren](/wiki/Ren_(human) "Ren (human)")," declared themselves, and claimed ownership of all within the outpost and that they way they took it was up to Skywalker. Skywalker countered, shooting back that all within the outpost, due it being a Jedi location, belonged to the Order; all the holocrons and relics belonged to Luke, for he was the last Jedi Knight even though he would not be for long. Skywalker told the Knights he could sense the dark side in them and would never let them have the artifacts. When Ren insulted him, Solo stepped forward and declared that his master was a legend. Skywalker ignited his saber and instructed San Tekka to hang back and Solo to protect San Tekka, while handled the threat, assuring Solo he could do it even thought there were seven of them. Ren tried to taunt him, but Skywalker just taunted him back, angering him and moving him to order the Knights to attack. As Solo watched on and called out to him, Skywalker engaged the knights, not intending to kill any of them, and managed to overpower them quite easily despite their numbers, which he explained as him not being alone because he had the powerful ally that was the Force by his side. He criticized them for their crude use of the Force, saying they wielded the dark side like a hammer, contrasted by his blade-like precision with the light side. He eventually used the Force to destroy the Knights' weapons and proceeded to prepare himself for a duel with [Ren](/wiki/Ren_(human) "Ren (human)"), who wielded a [red lightsaber](/wiki/Ren_(lightsaber) "Ren (lightsaber)"). Ren informed Skywalker that he activated a kill switch on his lightsaber that would detonate the room if it left his hand. Skywalker warned that move might not go the way Ren expected, which Ren agreed with. Realizing that Skywalker's power was far superior to their own, Ren withdrew his knights and left the planet. However, before he left, Ren removed his helmet and warned Skywalker about the strong presence of the dark side within Solo, before offering the boy chance, if he chose, to seek them out if decided he wanted another path.[[233]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_2-233)

Ultimately, the structure proved to be a source of more knowledge for Skywalker,[[219]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_Book-219) for he recovered the holocrons and other relics inside, leaving the outpost empty,[[225]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_3-225) but his nephew was prompted with the dark side of the Force.[[219]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_Book-219)

### Quest for Exegol

#### Visions and voices

:   "*But this…place, whatever it is. I'm seeing it for a reason, Lor. I can feel it.*"
:   ―Luke Skywalker to Lor San Tekka on his visions[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

As his first disciples grew older[[20]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_1-20) and new younglings came into the New Jedi Order's care, Skywalker had a Twi'lek named [Enyo](/wiki/Enyo "Enyo") help him as one of the younglings' instructors.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

In [21 ABY](/wiki/21_ABY "21 ABY"),[[239]](#cite_note-SotS_date-239) Skywalker started feeling an increasing darkness in the Force and having dark visions that frequently came to him in meditation. One day, Lor San Tekka, who was the only person Skywalker told about the visions, visited Skywalker in his temple on Ossus, his old friend's arrival heralded to Skywalker by Ben Solo. San Tekka greeted Skywalker and Solo, but once the latter was gone, asked Skywalker about the visions and whether or not they had become stronger or changed. Skywalker asked San Tekka to help him understand the visions and learn what the place in them was by standing vigil over him while he accessed the vision and described it. San Tekka was hesitant, but agreed, and Skywalker thus began the meditation.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

 [![The ancient Sith world of Exegol and its , which Luke Skywalker had a vision of in 21 ABY.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/05/NewCitadel.png/revision/latest?cb=20210110044738) [![The ancient Sith world of Exegol and its , which Luke Skywalker had a vision of in 21 ABY.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/05/NewCitadel.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210110044738)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/05/NewCitadel.png/revision/latest?cb=20210110044738) 

The ancient Sith world of Exegol and its [Sith Citadel](/wiki/Sith_Citadel "Sith Citadel"), which Luke Skywalker had a vision of in 21 ABY.

 

Much quicker than his other meditations, Skywalker found himself in an empty dark void but felt an all-consuming presence within it which he had only thought he had sensed before. Then the vision shifted and he found himself standing on the ancient hidden Sith world of [Exegol](/wiki/Exegol "Exegol"), though he did not know that was what he was seeing. Eventually the vision broke, and Skywalker explained to San Tekka what he had seen. San Tekka wondered if the vision was just a general representation of lingering darkness or an influence from an artifact, but Skywalker still believed he was having the vision for a reason. Skywalker asked San Tekka the reason he had come to Ossus in the first place, and he explained that there was an archaeological dig on the planet [Yoturba](/wiki/Yoturba "Yoturba") that he wanted to check out with Skywalker, convincing him to leave the temple by saying that it would be good for Solo to learn responsibilities while he was gone.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

#### Yoturba

:   "*I saw… a place. Darkness, and lightning. It was so* dry*, so old. And…There was* something there*. A…person. No. A shape. Like a…a shadow. It was…on me, I could feel it, I could hear it speaking to me.*"
:   ―Mico Haswell to Luke Skywalker, after being influenced by a kyber crystal bled with the dark side of the Force[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

 [![A Sith holocron, like the one discovered on Yoturba.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b3/SithHolocron-FFp25.png/revision/latest?cb=20241203000203) [![A Sith holocron, like the one discovered on Yoturba.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b3/SithHolocron-FFp25.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20241203000203)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b3/SithHolocron-FFp25.png/revision/latest?cb=20241203000203) 

A Sith holocron, like the one discovered on Yoturba.

 

Skywalker and San Tekka arrived at the archeological expedition on Yorturba that was being conducted by the [Lerct Historical Institute](/wiki/Lerct_Historical_Institute "Lerct Historical Institute") and were greeted by archaeologist Dr. [Beaumont Kin](/wiki/Beaumont_Kin "Beaumont Kin"), who informed them that the dig site was disappointing and they had not found a Jedi temple. Skywalker still carried a feeling that he was there for a reason despite this, and he would be proven correct when an archaeologist named [Tee Mairi](/wiki/Tee_Mairi "Tee Mairi") discovered a [Sith holocron](/wiki/Sith_holocron "Sith holocron") at the site. Skywalker recognized it immediately, and San Tekka recognized the writing on it as the Sith's mirrored [Aurebesh](/wiki/Aurebesh "Aurebesh"). Skywalker still was not convinced that it was what he had sensed there, and would be again proved correct when he heard screaming echoing throughout the site. Archeologist [Mico Haswell](/wiki/Mico_Haswell "Mico Haswell") had discovered a Sith kyber crystal and had his mind influenced by it, causing him to uncontrollably lash out and cause destruction with the Force. Luke restrained him with the Force, but in reaching out to him once again had a vision of Exegol that Haswell was now present in. Haswell leapt toward Skywalker in the vison and moved in a way that Skywalker recognized to be inhuman and even reptilian. Then Skywalker was on Yoturba again and managed to restrain the man with the Force again, calling a team of medics to sedate him via an injection.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

Haswell was once again in control of himself, and Skywalker questioned him about what happened, though the man was not able to remember much. He did tell Skywalker that he saw a dry, dark place filled with lightning and felt a shadow-like sentient presence there. Once Haswell passed out, Skywalker discovered the [bled](/wiki/Bleeding "Bleeding") kyber crystal in his hand, and confiscated it. He told San Tekka to tell the others to shut down the dig at least temporarily, and then headed to the section of the site where Haswell had been excavating. He discovered that the chamber was actually a crashed ship, and discovered more bled kyber crystals within it, that like the one Haswell had been holding, were the wrong size and shape for a lightsaber. This and his experience on the planet confirmed for Skywalker that something dark and evil was coming, deciding to leave San Tekka there to look over the dig site while he went to Tython in search of answers.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

#### Ghosts of the past

:   "*Remember, my son, no matter how dark the night may grow, you are never alone. You will know what to do, my son. Let the Force guide you. Let it flow through you as it flows through me. Use that power, and your instincts, for they are one and the same.*"
:   ―Anakin Skywalker, to Luke Skywalker[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

 [![The ruined temple and the seeing stone on Tython.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/bc/Tython_jedi_temple.png/revision/latest?cb=20220307054315) [![The ruined temple and the seeing stone on Tython.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/bc/Tython_jedi_temple.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220307054315)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/bc/Tython_jedi_temple.png/revision/latest?cb=20220307054315) 

The ruined temple and the seeing stone on Tython.

 

Skywalker traveled to Tython and visited the ruined Jedi temple known as the Force-henge, where he sat on the seeing stone and began to study the Sith Holocron and the kyber crystals and perform research through his many ancient tomes and personal notes. In a book that was a catalog of the Eeshaypher Collection, Skywalker discovered an entry about a [Sith wayfinder](/wiki/Sith_wayfinder "Sith wayfinder"), which he found remarkably similar in appearance and utility to the Sith holocron. The book stated that the wayfinders contained navigational data to an ancient Sith world called Ixigul—or in Skywalker's translation: Exegol. Skywalker gleaned from both the catalog and his other research that Exegol was meant to be a place of power and eternal life, and that its secret was so important that only two Sith wayfinders were ever made. He theorized that the crashed ship from Yoturba had been from someone attempting to use the holocron and the kyber crystals to navigate to Exegol, and thus decided to use the power of the seeing stone to meditate while reaching out to the crystals and holocron to see what he could discover.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

During his meditation, Skywalker once again had a vision of Exegol, but this time if felt like he was truly on the planet, causing him to wonder if the information stored in the holocron had allowed the seeing stone to actually transport him to the planet. Skywalker was then approached by nine Sith wraiths on the planet who ignited red lightsabers and began to attack him. Skywalker could block their lightsabers with his own, but could not attack the wraiths themselves, his blade and his body merely passing right through them. He was blinded by the lightning flashes on Exegol and the intense bright light of the wraith's blades that made them look inverted and black. Skywalker started struggling to fight them more and more until all nine wraiths eventually went in for one coordinated strike, but before they could a blue glow in the shape of a person holding a lightsaber appeared in from of Skywalker and pushed them away. Skywalker realized he was being assisted by a Force-spirit with a blue-bladed lightsaber and initially thought was Kenobi, but when the figure lowered his hood, Skywalker learned that it was his father, Anakin Skywalker. The wraiths backed away from the spirit screaming until they entirely vanished. Anakin Skywalker then reached out his hand to Luke, who took it and then found himself back on Tython as if he had never left.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

 [![Anakin Skywalker as a Force ghost](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f4/AnakinSkywalkerPeridea-PartEight.png/revision/latest?cb=20231011011136) [![Anakin Skywalker as a Force ghost](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f4/AnakinSkywalkerPeridea-PartEight.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20231011011136)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f4/AnakinSkywalkerPeridea-PartEight.png/revision/latest?cb=20231011011136) 

Anakin Skywalker as a Force ghost

 

Luke found that many of his books were burning and the holocron was completely destroyed, putting them out before speaking to Anakin. Anakin's figure flashed in and out and shifted between him as a young Jedi and him as the old man Luke had seen behind the mask of Darth Vader. Luke noticed that he seemed to be in pain and afraid. Anakin explained that there was a disturbance in the Force that was a shadow from an ancient time. He also clarified that the seeing stone had sent a part of Luke to Exegol and that it had taken everything in him to bring him back. Anakin reminded Luke that he could divert the path of the Force if he needed to, and that no matter how dark things seemed he was never alone as long as he allowed the Force to be his guide. Anakin then disappeared and left Luke alone until he heard the sound of a ship flying overhead and landing. It was Lando Calrissian, in the *[Lady Luck](/wiki/Lady_Luck "Lady Luck")*, who greeted Luke, but immediately told him that he needed to leave and that it was too dangerous for him to be there. But Calrissian told him that Lor San Tekka had told him where he was because Calrissian had information about the Sith, and also believed they were back.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

#### Calrissian's mission

:   "*We need to find the family. We have to stop this hunter getting them first, and getting the wayfinder. Luke, listen, you said it yourself. There's a disturbance in the Force, a, what did you call it, a shadow, and it's coming at us fast.*"
:   ―Lando Calrissian, to Skywalker on the family being pursued by Ochi of Bestoon[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

Calrissian brought Skywalker onto his ship and explained that overheard an assassin named Ochi of [Bestoon](/wiki/Bestoon "Bestoon") who had become [inebriated](/wiki/Alcohol "Alcohol") at a remote bar bragging that he had been sent by a Sith remnant to kidnap a girl from her parents. Lando elaborated that he had checked out a New Republic report, about [Halo Squadron](/wiki/Halo_Squadron "Halo Squadron") fighting off hunters attacking the family's ship Wild Space that backed up Ochi's story, explaining that the New Republic had apparently relocated the family after the incident. He then displayed a hologram of a [hex charm](/wiki/Sith_Eternal_crest "Sith Eternal crest") that the family had been carrying as proof that they were being hunted by the Sith. Skywalker recognized it immediately as a symbol of the Sith and decoded mirrored Aurebesh on it to be a Sith saying.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

 [![A hex charm, like the one depicted on the mysterious family's amulet.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/3e/Sith_Eternal_insignia.svg/revision/latest?cb=20191223220202) [![A hex charm, like the one depicted on the mysterious family's amulet.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/3e/Sith_Eternal_insignia.svg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20191223220202)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/3e/Sith_Eternal_insignia.svg/revision/latest?cb=20191223220202) 

A hex charm, like the one depicted on the mysterious family's amulet.

 

Calrissian expressed his worry over Ochi's implication that the Sith were still out there pulling strings, and wondered why they would want that family and go through the trouble of kidnapping the girl. Skywalker told Calrissian about his visions of Exegol, and told him that the way to the planet was hidden in a Sith wayfinder. Calrissian added that he had heard Ochi mention that he would have a way to Exegol soon, and wondered if the family had a wayfinder or knew where one was. But unbeknownst to Skywalker and Calrissian, the father of the family was a [strand-cast](/wiki/Strand-Cast "Strand-Cast") of the late Emperor Palpatine named [Dathan](/wiki/Dathan "Dathan"), and the girl, his daughter named [Rey](/wiki/Rey_Skywalker "Rey Skywalker"), was thus Palpatine's genetic granddaughter.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

Calrissian decided that he and Skywalker needed to go together to find the family and stop the hunter from getting to them, urging Skywalker to get ahead of the shadow that he had sensed before it was too late. Skywalker was hesitant to bring Calrissian along, but agreed to partially because he was aware of Calrissian's daughter's kidnapping and his friend's desperate hope that investigating this kidnapping could lead to her. They agreed to meet at the [Adelphi system](/wiki/Adelphi_system "Adelphi system") where Calrissian had a contact with the New Republic that they hoped could tell them where the New Republic had sent the family.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

#### Nightside

:   "*It's them. Those are the same kind of ships that were chasing the family. […] Okay, we're out of time. We have to get to that hangar.*"  
    "*The dark side. It's here. I can feel it.*"
:   ―Calrissian and Skywalker, as Ochi's forces and the Sith arrive on Nightside[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

 [![The Duros Shriv Suurgav](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6c/Shriv.png/revision/latest?cb=20171113221248) [![The Duros Shriv Suurgav](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6c/Shriv.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20171113221248)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6c/Shriv.png/revision/latest?cb=20171113221248) 

The Duros Shriv Suurgav

 

Skywalker and Calrissian met with the latter's contact, [Shriv Suurgav](/wiki/Shriv_Suurgav "Shriv Suurgav"), in the [New Republic staging outpost](/wiki/New_Republic_staging_outpost "New Republic staging outpost") over the planet [Adelphi](/wiki/Adelphi "Adelphi"). He gave them access to a database that allowed them to see that the pilot that had found and relocated the family, [Dina Dipurl](/wiki/Dina_Dipurl "Dina Dipurl"), had been killed in action, but also managed to uncover that the family had been sent to a [mining station](/wiki/Mining_station "Mining station") called [Nightside](/wiki/Nightside "Nightside") in the [Therezar system](/wiki/Therezar_system "Therezar system"). Skywalker and Calrissian traveled to the station with the hope of making contact with Calrissian's old acquaintance [Zargo Anaximander](/wiki/Zargo_Anaximander "Zargo Anaximander"). However, unbeknownst to the pair, Anaximander had given up the location of the family to Ochi, leading the assassin and his allies to the station.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

Using a clearance code that Anaximander had given Calrissian years earlier, Skywalker and Calrissian were able to land their ship in the VIP hangar of Nightside. They located the family's ship but discovered that it was empty. Using the Force, Skywalker located the family and sensed that they were aboard Anaximander's personal yacht *Goldstone*. R2-D2 then tapped into the station's surveillance systems and discovered from recordings that Dathan and Miramir were planning to escape with their daughter Rey. Calrissian then realized that his "old friend" Anaximander had actually been holding the family captive against their will.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

 [![The Droid Crush Pirates of Bestoon.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b7/DroidCrushPirates-2020DarthVader9.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20210128095229) [![The Droid Crush Pirates of Bestoon.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b7/DroidCrushPirates-2020DarthVader9.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210128095229)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b7/DroidCrushPirates-2020DarthVader9.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20210128095229) 

The Droid Crush Pirates of Bestoon.

 

Before Skywalker and Calrissian can reach the family, the station under attack by the Droid Crush Pirates of Bestoon, who, even though they were working for Ochi, ignored Ochi's orders for a clean extraction of the family and instead performed a [raid on Nightside](/wiki/Raid_on_Nightside "Raid on Nightside"). Skywalker was able to sense in the Force that the attackers were the same people pursuing the family. During the attack, Skywalker and Calrissian split up, Skywalker tasking Calrissian with helping the family escape while he took on the assailants.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

 [![The lightsaber of Darth Noctyss](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e6/DarthNoctyssLightsaber-ALI.png/revision/latest?cb=20220830025157) [![The lightsaber of Darth Noctyss](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e6/DarthNoctyssLightsaber-ALI.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/150?cb=20220830025157)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e6/DarthNoctyssLightsaber-ALI.png/revision/latest?cb=20220830025157) 

The lightsaber of Darth Noctyss

 

Left alone, Skywalker used the Force to track a Sith presence that he felt, ending up in a cable train station. A masked [Pantoran](/wiki/Pantoran "Pantoran") woman then landed there in a customized imperial [TIE Defender](/wiki/TIE/d_%22Defender%22_Multi-Role_Starfighter "TIE/d \"Defender\" Multi-Role Starfighter"), and when she exited it, Skywalker noticed that she appeared to be a Sith and was wielding the ancient lost [lightsaber of Darth Noctyss](/wiki/Lightsaber_of_Darth_Noctyss "Lightsaber of Darth Noctyss"). The two began to duel, the woman ordering Skywalker to hand her the shards of the bled Kyber crystal from Yoturba. Realizing that she was possessed by a Sith spirit, Skywalker offered to help free her while warning that he would defend himself. Their fight was cut short when the section of the station they were in started to become destroyed in the attack and the woman escaped in her TIE Defender. Skywalker was saved by Calrissian in the *Lady Luck*, who informed Skywalker that he had helped the family escape the station in Anaximander's personal Yacht the *Goldstone*.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

#### Torrenoteer Minor

:   "*I'm sorry, Lando. I'm sorry for everything. And of course it means the same to me as it does to you. That family needs us. We might be their only hope.*"  
    "*What's this, a Jedi with feelings? I thought that wasn't supposed to happen. Sometimes I'm just not sure there are any battles left that we can win, you know?*"  
    "*These people are important, and we're going to find them.*"
:   ―Skywalker consoles Calrissian on the loss of his daughter and resolves to find the fugitive family[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

Skywalker and Calrissian followed the *Goldstone* via transmissions aboard the *Lady Luck*, Skywalker telling Skywalker about his encounter with the Sith acolyte on Nightside. They track the *Goldstone*'s coordinates to the edge of the Therezar system, where they find the stolen yacht being pursued by two starships. Before the *Goldstone* jumped into hyperspace, R2-D2 was able to deduce that the family was fleeing to the [Torrenoteer system](/wiki/Torrenoteer_system "Torrenoteer system"). Following the trail of the *Goldstone*, Skywalker and Calrissian land *Lady Luck* on the desert world of [Torrenoteer Minor](/wiki/Torrenoteer_Minor "Torrenoteer Minor"), the two continuing their search for the family on two Stacker Polaris Stormwolf [speeder bikes](/wiki/Speeder_bike "Speeder bike"). While scouting the surrounding area, they discovered that Ochi's associates [Bosvarga](/wiki/Bosvarga "Bosvarga"), [Cerensco](/wiki/Cerensco "Cerensco"), and [Krastan](/wiki/Krastan "Krastan") landed their starship and were also hunting the fugitive family. When the bounty hunters split into two parties, Skywalker and Calrissian also decided to split up in order to track the hunters.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

 [![The fugitive family pursued and protected by Skywalker and Calrissian](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/57/Rey_mum_and_dad-TROS.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230116010912) [![The fugitive family pursued and protected by Skywalker and Calrissian](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/57/Rey_mum_and_dad-TROS.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20230116010912)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/57/Rey_mum_and_dad-TROS.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230116010912) 

The fugitive family pursued and protected by Skywalker and Calrissian

 

While riding his speeder bike through a ravine system, Skywalker was [ambushed](/wiki/Skirmish_on_Torrenoteer_Minor "Skirmish on Torrenoteer Minor") by the two bounty hunters, also riding speeder bikes. Skywalker deflected their blaster bolts of using his lightsaber, and hit one bolt back at one of the hunters, causing the hunter's speeder bike to crash in a ravine. Skywalker chased the second speeder over a lake, once again deflecting the hunter's blaster bolts, causing the hunter and his speeder bike to fall in the lake by hitting the bolts back at him. Skywalker then approached the [Weequay](/wiki/Weequay "Weequay") hunter in his wrecked vehicle and attempted to question him, but he fought Skywalker instead and subsequently died from being impaled by his speeder bike's steering vane. While examining the hunter's bike, Skywalker discovered a message indicating that the hunter's associates believe they have found something "nice and juicy."[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

Heading to coordinates transmitted by the hunter's associates, Skywalker found that the Gran hunter Krastan had captured Lando and was holding him in the prisoner clamp of a [CAP-2](/wiki/CAP-2 "CAP-2") walker. Skywalker fought Krastan with his lightsaber, killing him by defecting his own blaster bolts back at him. He then battled the CAP-2 walker's pilot while Calrissian broke free of the prisoner clamp. Skywalker sliced the CAP-2's left leg with his lightsaber, causing the machine to stumble, before using the Force to throw the machine to the ground. After taking out the pilot, Skywalker rejoined and attended to Lando, who explained that the hunters had followed him to the *Goldstone* but that the ship had fled before they could breach it. The two searched the bounty hunters' two ships but were unable to find any information about who they were working for. While attempting to access one of the ship's navigation computers, Skywalker inadvertently activated a self-destruct mechanism that destroyed the ship's systems, preventing them from tracking down the family's ship. Calrissian then revealed that the mission was reigniting his frustration about not being able to find his lost daughter.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

#### Polaar

:   "*Yupe Tashu was revealed as the true master of the Acolytes of the Beyond. […] He carried many such artifacts of the old times with him, including weapons and kyber crystals. But most important of all was the mask of Viceroy Exim Panshard. It was to Kiza he bequeathed this most powerful of relics.*"  
    "*She put it on, and Exim Panshard lived again.*"
:   ―Komat and Lando Calrissian, on how Kiza became possessed by Sith lord Exim Panshard[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)
