 [![The Acolytes of the Beyond](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e7/AcolytesOfTheBeyond-SecretsOfTheSith.png/revision/latest?cb=20230108122706) [![The Acolytes of the Beyond](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e7/AcolytesOfTheBeyond-SecretsOfTheSith.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20230108122706)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e7/AcolytesOfTheBeyond-SecretsOfTheSith.png/revision/latest?cb=20230108122706) 

The Acolytes of the Beyond

 

Skywalker had begun to suspect that the woman he encountered was related to a dark side cult called the [Acolytes of the Beyond](/wiki/Acolytes_of_the_Beyond "Acolytes of the Beyond") that he had fought before. Skywalker and Calrissian used his friend [Lina Graf](/wiki/Lina_Graf "Lina Graf")'s ship the *[Star Herald](/wiki/Star_Herald "Star Herald")* to travel to the planet [Polaar](/wiki/Polaar "Polaar") to get information from [Komat](/wiki/Komat "Komat"), a woman who was formerly part of the Acolytes of the Beyond who collected Sith artifacts like the lightsaber of [Darth Noctyss](/wiki/Darth_Noctyss "Darth Noctyss"). Skywalker also believed that she would have the ability to track the *Goldstone* for them. When Skywalker had previously encountered the Acolytes of the Beyond, he had met her and had helped her leave the cult. When they arrived on Polaar, a radioactive planet cut off from outside communication by an impenetrable interference field, they were greeted by a former Imperial mouse droid called [M-1](/wiki/M-1 "M-1") and a sword-wielding humanoid droid named [KB-68](/wiki/KB-68 "KB-68"), who was serving as [Komat](/wiki/Komat "Komat")'s sentry. Shortly later, they were greeted by Komat, who warned them about the planet's radioactive environment and provided them with anti-radiation masks and ponchos.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

Agreeing to help them if they helped her in turn, Komat took them to a wrecked [Mon Calamari cruiser](/wiki/MC-series_star_cruiser "MC-series star cruiser") that [crashed](/wiki/Skirmish_near_Polaar "Skirmish near Polaar") on Polaar during the Galactic Civil War, explaining that with the shields overloaded, the ship's fusion core had melted down, contaminating the planet with distronic radiation that rendered it uninhabitable for most lifeforms. Skywalker and Calrissian help Komat repair her particle capture grid, which she used to harvest radiation that KB-68 sold for supplies in the [Pirsen system](/wiki/Pirsen_system "Pirsen system"). In return, Komat revealed that the woman Skywalker had encountered was named [Kiza](/wiki/Kiza "Kiza"), and had once been her friend. She explained that Kiza had worked directly for [Yupe Tashu](/wiki/Yupe_Tashu "Yupe Tashu"), the leader Acolytes of the Beyond and one of the Emperor's advisors, who had gifted her the [Mask of Viceroy Exim Panshard](/wiki/Mask_of_Viceroy_Exim_Panshard "Mask of Viceroy Exim Panshard") which contained the preserved consciousness of the ancient Sith lord [Exim Panshard](/wiki/Exim_Panshard "Exim Panshard") and allowed him to take over her when she wore it. Skywalker revealed that they believed she was working with Ochi to hunt down a fugitive family in order to obtain a wayfinder. Explaining that two Sith wayfinders were made as navigational guides to Exegol, the hidden Sith world, Komat became determined to help Skywalker and Calrissian stop Kiza and keep her from reaching Exegol.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

 [![A Sith wayfinder](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/21/Wayfinder-TROS-GG.png/revision/latest?cb=20230419135731) [![A Sith wayfinder](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/21/Wayfinder-TROS-GG.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/150?cb=20230419135731)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/21/Wayfinder-TROS-GG.png/revision/latest?cb=20230419135731) 

A Sith wayfinder

 

Komat was able to locate the *Goldstone* using [hyperwave signal interception](/wiki/Hyperwave_signal_interceptor "Hyperwave signal interceptor") technology, but shortly after she did droids sent by Kiza [attacked the planet](/wiki/Skirmish_on_Polaar "Skirmish on Polaar"). Skywalker and Calrissian join Komat, KB-68, and Komat's feline pet [targon](/wiki/Targon "Targon") [Sekhmet](/wiki/Sekhmet "Sekhmet") in battling the droids. Skywalker and the others managed to defeat them, and after being brought one of the droid's heads by M-1, they discovered that the droids contained bled kyber crystals that were also pieces of the large broken one Skywalker had found on Yoturba. Skywalker decided that he would use the droids' navigational data to locate Kiza and make sure that she and subsequently Exim Panshard did not make it to Exegol, and thus make sure the Sith did not return. He did this with the assurance that while he did Calrissian and Komat would head to [Taw Provode](/wiki/Taw_Provode "Taw Provode"), where they had tracked the family to, and try to save the family from their pursuers.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

#### Kiza

:   "*I can help you right now, Kiza. I can see what the mask has done to you. How it feeds off you, off your anger and your pain. The more you suffer, the stronger it gets. It will kill you, and then when you die, it will find someone else. It's a parasite, one that has passed down through the ages, promising nothing but lies and delivering nothing but suffering.*"
:   ―Skywalker to Kiza, on the mask of Sith lord Exim Panshard[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

 [![Kiza, wearing the mask of Exim Panshard.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/cd/ShadowofSith-Kizamasked.png/revision/latest?cb=20231104235527) [![Kiza, wearing the mask of Exim Panshard.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/cd/ShadowofSith-Kizamasked.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20231104235527)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/cd/ShadowofSith-Kizamasked.png/revision/latest?cb=20231104235527) 

Kiza, wearing the mask of Exim Panshard.

 

Using coordinates retrieved from the droid lander's [navigation computer](/wiki/Navigation_computer "Navigation computer"), Skywalker and R2-D2 located Kiza by tracking the attackers' origin to an [asteroid](/wiki/Kiza%27s_world "Kiza's world") at the edge of the [Red Honeycomb Zone](/wiki/Red_Honeycomb_Zone "Red Honeycomb Zone"). He discovered her base, a wrecked Separatist [Core ship](/wiki/Core_ship "Core ship") and entered it tentatively. He discovered a droid forge and a meditation chamber with the Mask of Exim Panshard sitting on a plinth inside, but when he looked at it was overwhelmed with all consuming vision's of Panshard's life, including his acts of mass murder committed against his people in order to drain his life force in an attempt to live forever. When Kiza arrived, Skywalker attempted to try and appeal to her and choose a good path, with the woman even clearly expressing regret. He insisted that the mask was using her and she did not have to listen to it, but Kiza explained that it had promised her rebirth on Exegol, which Skywalker told her was a lie. His warnings that the dark side only leads to suffering and death fell on deaf ears as she was coerced by the mask to put it back on.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

Kiza engaged Skywalker in lightsaber combat, fueled by the knowledge of Panshard. Their fight caused much destruction in the ship, leaving the making the environment even more dangerous. While fighting, Kiza used the Force in attempt to pour hot molten metal onto Skywalker, but the Jedi Master used the Force to escape the ensuing molten fire in the droid foundry. However, molten material began to spread everywhere melt the ship. Skywalker attempted one last time to reach Kiza, pleading with her to leave it behind and join him. Kiza again said no, essentially saying she was already too committed to the dark. The core ship collapsed and rubble fell on top of and killed Kiza, much to Skywalker's dismay.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

Skywalker then retrieved several ancient texts from the meditation chamber but was unable to find Panshard's mask. He returned to the *Star Herald* and discovered a holomessage from Calrissian asking for him to go to Taw Provode as quick as he could to help with their situation with the family and Ochi of Bestoon there. But unbeknownst to Skywalker, Panshard's mask survived, and as he departed some of Kiza's droids followed programming to reforge the mask with melted bled kyber crystals, before placing the mask on Kiza's dead body, allowing Panshard to live again by possessing and reanimating her body.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

#### Clue to Exegol

:   "*Luke and I were tailing an old Jedi hunter. Ochi of Bestoon. He was carrying a clue that could lead to a wayfinder. We followed his ship halfway across the galaxy here. When we got to his ship, it was abandoned.... No clue. No wayfinder.*"
:   ―Lando Calrissian, on his and Luke's mission to Pasaana[[17]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-17)

 [![Skywalker and Lando Calrissian spent some time tracking down Ochi of Bestoon.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a8/Ochi.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200313031905) [![Skywalker and Lando Calrissian spent some time tracking down Ochi of Bestoon.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a8/Ochi.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20200313031905)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a8/Ochi.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200313031905) 

Skywalker and Lando Calrissian spent some time tracking down Ochi of Bestoon.

 

Skywalker arrived on Taw Provode just as Calrissian and Komat had been discovered and captured by Ochi of Bestoon and his subordinate [Corsec](/wiki/Corporate_Sector_Authority "Corporate Sector Authority") forces. Skywalker faced off with Ochi, and was surprised that his lightsaber did not cut through Ochi's dagger. The power of Ochi's dagger allowed him to hold himself off against the Jedi for some time until Skywalker managed to use his lightsaber to ignite a fuels reserve and trigger a massive explosion. Panshard appeared in his TIE Defender and started shooting at Skywalker and the others, leading Skywalker to realize that the mask was not really destroyed and the ancient Sith Lord lived on. Skywalker and Komat decided to chase him into space, while Calrissian and R2-D2 went after the family.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

Skywalker and Komat followed Panshard to [Taw Provode's solitary moon](/wiki/Taw_Provode%27s_solitary_moon "Taw Provode's solitary moon"), using the *Star Herald* to shoot his TIE Defender down and strand him on the moon. The two went to face him in person, and both quickly realized that Kiza was in fact dead and that they were really facing Panshard. Panshard told Skywalker to tell him how to get to Exegol or be killed, but Skywalker and Komat refused and instead faced off with their lightsabers. Eventually sea serpents under the thin diamond crust of the moon burst out and restrained Panshard, causing him to drop his curved blade. Skywalker picked it up and then called the mask to him with the Force before slicing it into four pieces with the two lightsabers and destroying Panshard for good.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

Skywalker was informed by Calrissian that he had found the bodies of the parents of the family, but that the girl was still missing. Skywalker, Calrissian, R2-D2, and Komat traveled to [Neftali](/wiki/Neftali "Neftali"), where they buried them and honored their lives. Skywalker and Calrissian worried that Ochi had successfully captured the girl and taken her to Exegol, but they could not be sure, and decided to keep looking for Ochi.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

 [![Luke and Lando stand in front of the Bestoon Legacy on Pasaana](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/bd/Luke_%26_Lando_on_Pasaana-TROSAdaptation1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250226190826) [![Luke and Lando stand in front of the Bestoon Legacy on Pasaana](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/bd/Luke_%26_Lando_on_Pasaana-TROSAdaptation1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/280?cb=20250226190826)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/bd/Luke_%26_Lando_on_Pasaana-TROSAdaptation1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250226190826) 

Luke and Lando stand in front of the Bestoon Legacy on Pasaana

 

After Calrissian took a time to recover by working with Komat at her homestead, Skywalker and Calrissian eventually [tracked](/wiki/Mission_to_Pasaana "Mission to Pasaana") Ochi to [Pasaana](/wiki/Pasaana "Pasaana") where they found [his ship](/wiki/Bestoon_Legacy "Bestoon Legacy") but no Ochi. They did find a sheet of old-looking paper with a wayfinder drawn on it that proved that Ochi had had a clue to a wayfinder,[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7) but other than that, the trail went cold.[[17]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-17) Skywalker then returned to Ossus to continue running his Jedi academy and left Calrissian on Pasanna, who decided to use the planet as his base to look for both the lost girl and his daughter. Skywalker stored the pieces of bled kyber crystal and the shards of Exim Panshard's mask in the temple with other artifacts.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7) Skywalker would chronicle his efforts to trace the disturbance in the Force and find the Sith Wayfinder in the Rammahgon throughout his explorations in the galaxy.[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4)

### Telling a story

:   "*Considering… Well, your family, your skill in the Force, and that you'll be one of the first students to complete your training… It seems likely that you could hold a position of leadership in the Jedi Order to come.*"
:   ―Luke Skywalker, to Ben Solo[[240]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_50_2020-240)

 [![By passing on his experience to Solo, Skywalker hoped to guide his nephew on the path to becoming a true Knight of the Jedi Order.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/1c/MasterAndApprentice-2020StarWars50.png/revision/latest?cb=20250122064428) [![By passing on his experience to Solo, Skywalker hoped to guide his nephew on the path to becoming a true Knight of the Jedi Order.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/1c/MasterAndApprentice-2020StarWars50.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20250122064428)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/1c/MasterAndApprentice-2020StarWars50.png/revision/latest?cb=20250122064428) 

By passing on his experience to Solo, Skywalker hoped to guide his nephew on the path to becoming a true Knight of the Jedi Order.

 

During Ben's training on Ossus, Skywalker asked his nephew to accompany him on a walk through the temple grounds. As they walked, Skywalker told Solo that he was almost ready to undergo the [Jedi Trials](/wiki/Jedi_Trials "Jedi Trials"), the completion of which would mark the end of their time together as Master and apprentice.[[240]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_50_2020-240)

According to Skywalker, Solo would no longer have to listen to a master since he would be free to make his own decisions as a fully-trained Jedi Knight. In addition, Skywalker acknowledged Solo's potential to become a future leader in the Jedi Order that he was working to restore, given his nephew's status as a Skywalker, his strength in the Force, and the fact that he stood poised to be among the first in his generation to complete his instruction in the Jedi arts. Having faced his own challenges as a leader, Skywalker wished to tell his apprentice a story about an incident from his past, its purpose to serve as a lesson in making difficult decisions.[[240]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_50_2020-240)

Skywalker's story centered on his discovery and subsequent use of the [Grim Rose](/wiki/Grim_Rose "Grim Rose"), an ancient weapon that he discovered upon returning to the [Living Sea](/wiki/Living_Sea "Living Sea") on the planet [Gazian](/wiki/Gazian "Gazian"). Solo learned that Skywalker had considered using the Grim Rose to assassinate Emperor Palpatine; using a sample of Palpatine's blood, the weapon could be used to target and kill the Emperor. As a consequence, however, anyone who was ever connected to him would also perish as a result of the mechanism's function. Solo theorized that the weapon had the capacity to destroy the Sith. Being aware of Vader's connection to Palpatine, Solo was certain that the weapon would have scanned Vader as well, ultimately resulting in the deaths of both Sith Lords. Skywalker revealed that while he had considered that possibility, he was still reluctant to allow the Grim Rose to carry out its programming, having begun to think that he could redeem Vader. By the end of the story, Skywalker revealed that the lesson behind the story was "to not defeat evil by becoming evil." Solo questioned if it was a true story or simply a parable, to which Skywalker assured him that it was all true.[[240]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_50_2020-240)

### Fallen apprentice

#### Ben Solo's betrayal

:   "*I saw darkness. I sensed it building in him. I'd seen it in moments during his training. But then I looked inside, and it was beyond what I ever imagined. Snoke had already turned his heart. He would bring destruction, pain, death, and the end of everything I love because of what he will become. And for the briefest moment of pure instinct, I thought I could stop it. It passed like a fleeting shadow. And I was left with shame and with consequence. And the last thing I saw were the eyes of a frightened boy whose master had failed him.*"
:   ―Luke Skywalker[[8]](#cite_note-Episode_VII-8)

 [![Sensing the darkness within Ben Solo, Skywalker instinctively moved to strike down his nephew.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/bc/LukesMistake-TLJ.png/revision/latest?cb=20180417033624) [![Sensing the darkness within Ben Solo, Skywalker instinctively moved to strike down his nephew.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/bc/LukesMistake-TLJ.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/276?cb=20180417033624)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/bc/LukesMistake-TLJ.png/revision/latest?cb=20180417033624) 

Sensing the darkness within Ben Solo, Skywalker instinctively moved to strike down his nephew.

 

One night in [28 ABY](/wiki/28_ABY "28 ABY"),[[241]](#cite_note-Temple_destruction_date-241) Skywalker, sensing the darkness within his nephew Ben growing in glimpses during his training, decided to probe Solo's mind as he lay asleep. He learned that Snoke had turned his apprentice's heart to the dark side,[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) and experienced a brief dark vision[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4) that Solo would bring nothing but death and destruction[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) and leave Skywalker's loved ones in anguish. Despite the love for his nephew,[[235]](#cite_note-TLC-235) in a flash of defensive instinct,[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4) Skywalker thought he could stop that future and for a brief moment of pure instinct he raised his lightsaber to destroy him, believing that it was the only way to halt his descent into darkness and prevent the end of everything he loved. This instinct was gone almost the second that it had come, and Skywalker was immediately filled with shame.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

Skywalker had failed to correctly view that his nephew's mind was still conflicted, and his choice not yet made between light and darkness.[[219]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_Book-219) From Rey's point of view, Skywalker's failure as not only Solo's Jedi Master, but his uncle and family, had been completed when this occurred.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

 [![Skywalker's Jedi Temple is destroyed by Ben Solo.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/88/DestructionOfTheJediTemple-TheRiseOfKyloRen1.png/revision/latest?cb=20191224031329) [![Skywalker's Jedi Temple is destroyed by Ben Solo.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/88/DestructionOfTheJediTemple-TheRiseOfKyloRen1.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20191224031329)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/88/DestructionOfTheJediTemple-TheRiseOfKyloRen1.png/revision/latest?cb=20191224031329) 

Skywalker's Jedi Temple is destroyed by Ben Solo.

 

Solo had already awoken to see his uncle standing over him with his lightsaber raised. Confused and angry, Solo pulled his own [lightsaber](/wiki/Kylo_Ren%27s_lightsaber "Kylo Ren's lightsaber") to him in self-defense and attacked Skywalker, using the Force to pull down the hut on top of him.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) Solo emerged from the hut and screamed toward the temple, asking Skywalker why he had done it, and in his anger bringing down a lightning strike with the Force that destroyed the temple and set it on fire.[[3]](#cite_note-Timelines-3)[[20]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_1-20) When Skywalker came around, he emerged from the rubble of the hut to find his temple destroyed, with his other apprentices either killed or vanished along with Solo. This effectively left Skywalker the last of the Jedi once more[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) as he was after the death of his own master, Yoda, decades earlier.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-12)

Three of Skywalker's apprentices, Tai, Hennix, and Voe, eventually returned to the temple while it burned and were not able to sense his presence, which they normally felt overwhelmingly in the Force. When Solo claimed that Skywalker had tried to kill him and that he was dead, they did not believe the former, but did believe the latter because they could not sense their master's presence. Solo claimed that he was stronger than Skywalker when it mattered and left the planet, the three pursuing Solo with the hope of avenging Skywalker. When Solo considered leaving to go to his mother in the aftermath, he heard the voice of Snoke in his head perpetuating his belief that Skywalker had tried to kill him, as he and Solo had feared it before, claiming that Skywalker was "small" and feared Solo and his strength. Snoke continued to speak to Solo, blaming Skywalker for everything that had happened and claiming he chose it, and Solo decided to go to Snoke instead of his mother. On the [Amaxine Space Station](/wiki/Amaxine_Space_Station "Amaxine Space Station"), with Snoke, Solo noticed the man's appearance and asked him what Skywalker had done to him, but Snoke redirected the conversation to what Skywalker had done to Solo. Solo tried to claim it did not matter because he had killed the Jedi Master, but Snoke warned that Skywalker was not dead and would not die so easily, though agreed to stop talking about Skywalker because he had "stolen" too much of his life already.[[20]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_1-20) Solo eventually became the apprentice of Snoke and took the new name "Kylo Ren," becoming the leader of a group of dark side warriors known as the Knights of Ren.[[8]](#cite_note-Episode_VII-8)

 [![Skywalker cries out in anguish at discovering the temple destroyed.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/98/LukeArtooTempleDestroyed-SWI205.png/revision/latest?cb=20230816014430) [![Skywalker cries out in anguish at discovering the temple destroyed.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/98/LukeArtooTempleDestroyed-SWI205.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/260?cb=20230816014430)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/98/LukeArtooTempleDestroyed-SWI205.png/revision/latest?cb=20230816014430) 

Skywalker cries out in anguish at discovering the temple destroyed.

 

Left deeply affected and mentally broken by what he believed to be his ultimate failure, Skywalker lost faith in the Force and the vision of the Jedi for having failed to rebuild the Jedi Order. Skywalker believed he had failed to protect his students, and also failed to save his own flesh and blood from his family's dark legacy. So Skywalker fled into self-imposed [exile](/wiki/Exile_(punishment) "Exile (punishment)"), vanishing from the galaxy at-large without a trace. No one knew for sure where he went, but those closest to him believed he went off in search of the first Jedi Temple.[[8]](#cite_note-Episode_VII-8)

To those who knew what Skywalker was seeking, there remained a way to find him: after destroying the Jedi, the Empire had begun to seek out the thousands of Jedi temples scattered across the galaxy, with the aim to prevent anyone from discovering the lost secrets of the Order. As such, Imperial authorities discovered the locations of some of the first Jedi Temples. The partial map remained within the archives of the Empire. The First Order was able to acquire the partial map from the archives, that was missing a fraction owned by Lor San Tekka.[[242]](#cite_note-TFA_novel-242) As he had downloaded Imperial star maps during his time on the first Death Star,[[243]](#cite_note-R2-D2-243) R2-D2, Skywalker's faithful astromech, was able to recover the contents of the map.[[242]](#cite_note-TFA_novel-242)

#### Kylo Ren's vision

:   "*Your Uncle feared you. Feared how formidable you could become. Your hatred for him is right. Skywalker would have murdered you in your sleep. Rise above what's holding you back. Strike. Strike against the light side within you! STRIKE!*"
:   ―Snoke to Kylo Ren as he fought a vision of Skywalker[[244]](#cite_note-AOR_Snoke-244)

 [![Kylo Ren fights an apparition of Skywalker in the Cave of Evil](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/10/KyloVsVisionLuke-AORSnoke1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190912203652) [![Kylo Ren fights an apparition of Skywalker in the Cave of Evil](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/10/KyloVsVisionLuke-AORSnoke1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20190912203652)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/10/KyloVsVisionLuke-AORSnoke1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190912203652) 

Kylo Ren fights an apparition of Skywalker in the Cave of Evil

 

Later, while training Kylo Ren with an exercise in which he forced Ren to stop himself from falling, Snoke informed the boy that Skywalker would have caught him if he had not caught himself, and would have thus held him back. Snoke then took Ren to the Cave of Evil on Dagobah, where Ren could sense that Skywalker had been there, Snoke revealing that he had trained there before becoming one of the most formidable Jedi. Ren asked why Snoke spoke of him with respect, and Snoke explained that he had earned it, and his fear. Ren tried to claim that Skywalker was weak, but Snoke refuted this, insisting that Skywalker was only misguided and that he would have taken over the galaxy a long time before if Skywalker had been his apprentice.[[244]](#cite_note-AOR_Snoke-244)

Ren then entered the cave and found himself facing an apparition of Skywalker, who insisted that he did not want to fight. Ren fought him anyway, his red crossguard lightsaber clashing against Skywalker's green. Snoke egged Ren on and validated his hatred as he fought his old master, insisting that Skywalker had feared what Ren would become, would have murdered him in his sleep, and was representative of the light side holding him back. Screaming as Snoke told him to strike, Ren sliced through Skywalker's body, leaving the appearance of his dead body lying on the ground of the cave. While staring at the corpse, Ren declared himself ready.[[244]](#cite_note-AOR_Snoke-244)

### Exile on Ahch-To

#### Shutting himself off from the Force

:   "*You've closed yourself off from the Force.*"
:   ―Rey, to Luke Skywalker[[17]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-17)

 [![After exiling himself to Ahch-To, Skywalker resolved to die as the last Jedi.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a6/Old_Luke.png/revision/latest?cb=20160406143010) [![After exiling himself to Ahch-To, Skywalker resolved to die as the last Jedi.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a6/Old_Luke.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/192?cb=20160406143010)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a6/Old_Luke.png/revision/latest?cb=20160406143010) 

After exiling himself to Ahch-To, Skywalker resolved to die as the last Jedi.

 

The Jedi Master fled to the location of the Temple—on an aquatic planet named Ahch-To—that he discovered by studying the spread of uneti saplings.[[218]](#cite_note-TLJ_VD-218) Having failed in bringing back the Jedi Order, Skywalker intended nothing more than to live out the rest of his days there in reclusive exile[[237]](#cite_note-USW,NE-237) and had pledged to protect the hidden world and its many secrets.[[245]](#cite_note-TLJ:_A_Junior_Novel-245) Taking the relics he had uncovered with him, the [hermit](/wiki/Hermit "Hermit") [shut himself off from the Force](/wiki/Sever_Force "Sever Force"),[[237]](#cite_note-USW,NE-237) consequently ceasing the guidance of Obi-Wan Kenobi, Yoda, and Anakin Skywalker's spirits.[[216]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Jedi-216) It had taken years for him to learn the discipline of blocking the Force out, and he considered the fact that it was harder to do so than to feel it and let it in a dark secret that was never taught. He believed the Force and the Jedi had many secrets and that not even the greatest and in his opinion arrogant Jedi Masters could understand all of it. Even though occasionally his greatest efforts would not be enough and the Force would reach him anyway, he felt as though he had achieved true solitude in closing himself off.[[246]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_1-246)

Among the relics Luke had collected and brought into his exile were the sacred Jedi texts and the Jedi Crusader pendant.[[218]](#cite_note-TLJ_VD-218) Some of which were mentioned as being taken from the island long before in the Lanais' songs. The [Caretakers](/wiki/Caretakers "Caretakers") tolerated Skywalker's presence, though he had learned the [Lanai's language](/wiki/Lanai%27s_language "Lanai's language") and ways, insisted on doing most of their duties to care for him himself, and had appeared each month on the [Festival of Return](/wiki/Festival_of_Return "Festival of Return"), something which puzzled [Alcida-Auka](/wiki/Alcida-Auka "Alcida-Auka").[[247]](#cite_note-TLJ:_Expanded_Edition-247)

Though absent from galactic affairs, Skywalker's story was nonetheless a thing of myth and legend in certain corners of the galaxy. His exploits in the Galactic Civil War were known to the [Resistance](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance"), a band of freedom fighters led by now-General Organa to [combat](/wiki/Cold_War "Cold War") the rise of the First Order. Resistance fighter pilot [Jessika Pava](/wiki/Jessika_Pava "Jessika Pava") learned that C-3PO, who also served in the Resistance, knew Skywalker and asked the droid to tell her a story about his former master. Threepio regaled her with the tale of Skywalker's encounter with Sarco Plank on Devaron, and how Skywalker kept his promise to Farnay and indeed returned to Devaron.[[48]](#cite_note-weapon-jedi-48) Members of the First Order, however, had a less-than-ideal view of the Jedi Master; the First Order taught their followers, including [stormtroopers](/wiki/First_Order_stormtrooper "First Order stormtrooper") like [FN-2187](/wiki/Finn "Finn"), that Skywalker was an enemy who helped destroy the Empire. Despite the knowledge about Skywalker, the mystical elements of his life, as well as the Jedi in general, were seen as mythic rather than historic.[[248]](#cite_note-EW_Luke-248)

 [![Prior to Rey's arrival, Luke Skywalker hears the will of the Force despite his efforts to block it out.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/01/LukeWillOfTheForce-TheLastJedi1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20220414083723) [![Prior to Rey's arrival, Luke Skywalker hears the will of the Force despite his efforts to block it out.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/01/LukeWillOfTheForce-TheLastJedi1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/280?cb=20220414083723)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/01/LukeWillOfTheForce-TheLastJedi1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20220414083723) 

Prior to Rey's arrival, Luke Skywalker hears the will of the Force despite his efforts to block it out.

 

Prior to Rey's arrival on Ahch-To, Luke Skywalker had a dream while sleeping in his hut. In his dream, he saw the life he would never have, one in which he never left Tatooine and remained in the moisture farming business with his uncle, marrying Camie Marstrap and allowing the Galactic Empire to shatter the Rebel Alliance and destroy more planets with the Death Star. Luke eventually awoke, trying to shake away his dream, and left his hut. He was still astonished at the oceans of Ahch-To, which he attributed to growing up in the deserts of Tatooine. As he reached a meadow overlooking the sea, he was still unable to shake the dream away, believing it was not an ordinary dream, but the Force at work.[[247]](#cite_note-TLJ:_Expanded_Edition-247) Also shortly before Rey arrived, one of the moments where the Force demanded to be heard and got through despite Skywalker's block occurred. In that moment, the old Jedi Master undeniably felt that the Force was telling him that someone had found him.[[246]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_1-246)

#### Skywalker is found

:   "*You think what? I'm going to walk out with a laser sword and face down the whole First Order?* "
:   ―Luke Skywalker to Rey[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

In [34 ABY](/wiki/34_ABY "34 ABY"), Organa sent Resistance fighter Poe Dameron,[[8]](#cite_note-Episode_VII-8) the son of Shara Bey and Kes Dameron,[[210]](#cite_note-TFA_VD-210) to Jakku to find San Tekka and recover the map to Skywalker's alleged location, as she hoped her brother would return and help in the fight against the dark side. The First Order also learned of the map and sought it so they could destroy the last Jedi. Dameron found San Tekka living in the village of [Tuanul](/wiki/Tuanul "Tuanul"), and the old explorer gave the map to Dameron, who in turn gave it to his astromech droid [BB-8](/wiki/BB-8 "BB-8"), before Kylo Ren and the First Order arrived and [sacked](/wiki/Attack_on_Tuanul "Attack on Tuanul") the village. Ren killed San Tekka and took Dameron into custody in the hopes of finding the map, while BB-8 came into the possession of a Jakku [scavenger](/wiki/Scavenger "Scavenger") named Rey. Rey believed that Skywalker was only a myth, but she too possessed strength in the Force that she had not yet discovered. Rey teamed with FN-2187, an ex-Stormtrooper who took the name Finn after defecting from the First Order, and, with the help of Han Solo and Chewbacca, sought to return the map fragment to the Resistance.[[8]](#cite_note-Episode_VII-8)

 [![Rey, a scavenger from Jakku, implored Skywalker to help the Resistance against the First Order.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/91/Luke_Skywalker_Found_TFA.png/revision/latest?cb=20160416220757) [![Rey, a scavenger from Jakku, implored Skywalker to help the Resistance against the First Order.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/91/Luke_Skywalker_Found_TFA.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/256?cb=20160416220757)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/91/Luke_Skywalker_Found_TFA.png/revision/latest?cb=20160416220757) 

Rey, a scavenger from Jakku, implored Skywalker to help the Resistance against the First Order.

 

After Rey discovered the lightsaber that once belonged to both Anakin and Luke in the [pirate castle](/wiki/Takodana_Castle "Takodana Castle") belonging to [Maz Kanata](/wiki/Maz_Kanata "Maz Kanata") on [Takodana](/wiki/Takodana "Takodana"), a thousand year-old being who had knowledge of the Force, she began to unlock her own Force abilities. After being captured by Ren on Takodana and briefly interrogated onboard [Starkiller Base](/wiki/Starkiller_Base "Starkiller Base") in an attempt by Ren to analyze Rey's thoughts to find the path to Skywalker, BB-8's map fragment was soon combined with R2-D2's, and together they provided a complete map to Ahch-To. Accompanied by Chewbacca, Rey flew the *Millennium Falcon* to Ahch-To and found the old Jedi Master on an island.[[8]](#cite_note-Episode_VII-8)

When Rey arrived on the island, Skywalker was standing up top the [saddle](/wiki/Saddle_(Ahch-To) "Saddle (Ahch-To)"), summoning the will to try to torch the tree library again having just failed to do so.[[247]](#cite_note-TLJ:_Expanded_Edition-247) While standing there, Skywalker was reflecting that his efforts to block the Force from him was impossible as it always demanded to be heard. But in that moment, the old Jedi Master felt that someone had found him, turning around to see who was, discovering Rey.[[246]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_1-246) After making her way to Skywalker, Rey presented him with his father's old weapon as a symbol of the only hope that the galaxy had left.[[242]](#cite_note-TFA_novel-242)

#### Confronted with the past

:   "*I can't teach you. […] I will never train another generation of Jedi. I came to this island to die. It's time for the Jedi to end.*"
:   ―Skywalker, to Rey[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

 [![Though reluctant to take on another apprentice, Skywalker chose to train Rey after R2-D2 replayed Organa's call for help.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ab/LeiaMessageTLJ.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180111022812) [![Though reluctant to take on another apprentice, Skywalker chose to train Rey after R2-D2 replayed Organa's call for help.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ab/LeiaMessageTLJ.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/264?cb=20180111022812)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ab/LeiaMessageTLJ.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180111022812) 

Though reluctant to take on another apprentice, Skywalker chose to train Rey after R2-D2 replayed Organa's call for help.

 

After taking his old lightsaber and looking it over, Skywalker,[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) emotion roiled over his face,[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4) hoping to lose the blade once again,[[36]](#cite_note-Complete_Visual_New-36) tossed it behind him and left the plateau, with Rey following close behind him. Despite her repeated attempts, Skywalker declined to help her or the Resistance, even though he knew that the girl had been sent by his sister Leia.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) Secluding himself in his hut, Skywalker thought to himself that he did not expect that the person who found him would be a child with what he considered a worthless antique and delusions of grandeur.[[246]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_1-246)

Later, Luke was folding his old clothes then heard Rey trying to reach out to him again by knocking on his door but he told her to go away. However, Luke was surprised when his door broke open but was even more surprised to see his old friend Chewbacca was with her. Hearing how they got to where he was with the Millennium Falcon, Luke asked where Han was.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) Rey and Chewbacca told him that his old friend and brother-in-law was dead, murdered by Kylo Ren, which stunned Skywalker. Feeling regret for not having sensed his brother-in-law's death because he had disconnected himself from the Force, Luke was comforted by the Wookiee, who hugged him, before Skywalker comforted Chewbacca back.[[246]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_1-246)

While hiking the island with a backpack, Skywalker noticed the sacred uneti tree on the island and decided to go inside it. There he found Rey,[[246]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_1-246) who had discovered several original texts of Jedi teachings hidden there. Skywalker learned that she had the Force within her and sought assistance to understand it and her place in the galaxy. Skywalker refused to teach her revealed that he had come to the place where the Jedi started in order to die, and voiced his belief that it was time for the Jedi Order to die.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

 [![Skywalker agreed to give Rey three lessons about the Force](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e3/ThreeLessons-SoH.png/revision/latest?cb=20190826132737) [![Skywalker agreed to give Rey three lessons about the Force](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e3/ThreeLessons-SoH.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190826132737)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e3/ThreeLessons-SoH.png/revision/latest?cb=20190826132737) 

Skywalker agreed to give Rey three lessons about the Force

 

The next night, the former Jedi Master slipped into the *Millennium Falcon* and recalled the adventures he had experienced. While aboard, Skywalker reunited with R2 who, after he insisted that he could not be convinced to help, replayed Leia's holographic message to Kenobi. Although Skywalker grumbled that the tactic "was a cheap move" on the droid's part, it nevertheless inspired Skywalker to agree to give Rey some basic initiation training as a Jedi, explaining the basic foundations of the Force.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) R2 also told Skywalker that she had grown up on a desert planet before discovered a droid carrying secret data vital to the Rebellion, which he recognized a similar story to his own. He approached Rey while she slept, telling her that R2 had told him her story[[246]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_1-246) and that he would give her three lessons to both teach her the ways of the Jedi and also show her why the Order needed to end.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

#### A reluctant teacher and enlightenment

:   "*What do you know about the Force?*"  
    "*It's a power that Jedi have that lets them control people… and make things float.*"  
    "*Impressive. Every word in that sentence was wrong.*"
:   ―Luke Skywalker and Rey[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

 [![Skywalker gives Rey her first lesson.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/65/Rey_and_Luke_First_Lesson_TLJ.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200624103926) [![Skywalker gives Rey her first lesson.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/65/Rey_and_Luke_First_Lesson_TLJ.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200624103926)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/65/Rey_and_Luke_First_Lesson_TLJ.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200624103926) 

Skywalker gives Rey her first lesson.

 

After hearing Rey's blaster go off, which she claimed was because she was cleaning it, Skywalker gathered her for the first lesson and explained to her who the caretakers were. During the lesson, Skywalker explained to her that her idea of the Force as a power to have was wrong and that it was not about lifting rocks, explaining that it was an energy field throughout the universe. After Rey misunderstood Skywalker's instructions to reach out and reached out her arm, Skywalker pranked her by touching her hand with a leaf and telling her it was the Force before hitting her with it. Rey then tried again, Skywalker telling her that the Force and the light was so much more than just the Jedi as she felt it. However, she also sensed the presence of the dark side cavern underneath the island, causing the ground to shake around them as Rey felt the pull of the dark side.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

 [![Rey practices using her lightsaber with a large rock.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/WindwailerRey.png/revision/latest?cb=20210215191019) [![Rey practices using her lightsaber with a large rock.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/WindwailerRey.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210215191019)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/WindwailerRey.png/revision/latest?cb=20210215191019) 

Rey practices using her lightsaber with a large rock.

 

Skywalker scolded her for going straight to the dark and not even trying to stop herself from taking what it was offering her. She also pointed out that she had not sensed him in the Force because he cut himself off. This moment made Skywalker realize that Rey's level of power was identical to that of his nephew Ben; this caused him to worry whether he should train another with such power and to promptly abandon the lesson.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) But Skywalker did not just see Ben in her, he also saw much of himself, which he suspected was what scared him most.[[249]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_2-249) Skywalker realized something else from this lesson; that Rey was the Emperor, Darth Sidious', granddaughter, which is why she was so easily drawn to the dark side.[[197]](#cite_note-S:AFaW-197) He later found her practicing with a [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff") and then with the returned lightsaber. Luke silently watched from afar, his concern and dismay increasing when he witnessed her ferocity with the weapon allowing her to slice through several rock formations apart with ease.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) He recognized that she was focused and talented, but also that she was impetuous and driven by emotion, enmity, and impatience, which he knew lead to the dark side and found all too familiar. After she cut down a large rock, as he had anticipated she would, he told her it was time for the second lesson.[[250]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_3-250)

Eventually, after the second lesson, Skywalker sat and spoke with Rey, telling her that the true legacy of the Jedi was failure, and revealing that they were responsible for the creation of Darth Vader. Rey pointed out that he had seen the light in Vader and turned him,[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) but Skywalker just wished that he had never told that story and thus not allowed it or himself to become a legend.[[250]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_3-250) He then revealed that his nephew Ben had the same tremendous power in the Force she had and was corrupted by Snoke's teachings to the dark side, becoming Kylo Ren. He then destroyed the Jedi temple Skywalker had started, taking some of his other apprentices with him and killing the rest. Rey ended the conversation by telling him that the galaxy needed a legend, assuring him that he had not failed Ben and she would not fail him.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) That night, Rey having reminded him that his solitude had cost him his connections to those he loved and not just his connection to the Force, Skywalker went to the [meditation ledge](/wiki/Meditation_ledge "Meditation ledge"). Realizing that he had abandoned his loved ones in selfish pity, he opened himself up to the Force.[[250]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_3-250) He managed to regain his Force abilities, allowing him to sense his sister from across the galaxy.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

 [![Disturbed by Rey's growing connection to Kylo Ren, Skywalker demanded that she leave the island.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/44/Luke_interrupting_Rey_and_Kylo_Ren.png/revision/latest?cb=20180731154143) [![Disturbed by Rey's growing connection to Kylo Ren, Skywalker demanded that she leave the island.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/44/Luke_interrupting_Rey_and_Kylo_Ren.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20180731154143)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/44/Luke_interrupting_Rey_and_Kylo_Ren.png/revision/latest?cb=20180731154143) 

Disturbed by Rey's growing connection to Kylo Ren, Skywalker demanded that she leave the island.

 

Skywalker went to find Rey in order to tell her that he was going back to the Resistance with her[[247]](#cite_note-TLJ:_Expanded_Edition-247) but instead he found Rey talking with Kylo Ren through the Force due to a [Force-bond](/wiki/Force-bond "Force-bond") that he previously was unable to detect. Witnessing them touching hands,[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) Skywalker thought that they were in league. He had gestured at the walls and the ceiling of the [hut](/wiki/Rey%27s_hut "Rey's hut") Rey was in, and all the stone blocks were shot outward[[245]](#cite_note-TLJ:_A_Junior_Novel-245) from the hut's center, scattering them around the bench.[[247]](#cite_note-TLJ:_Expanded_Edition-247) Having decided that Rey could not be trusted anymore, he ordered her to leave the planet.[[245]](#cite_note-TLJ:_A_Junior_Novel-245)

#### Revelations

:   "*He would bring destruction, pain, death, and the end of everything I love because of what he will become. And for the briefest moment of pure instinct, I thought I could stop it. It passed like a fleeting shadow. And I was left with shame and with consequence. And the last thing I saw were the eyes of a frightened boy whose master had failed him.*"
:   ―Luke Skywalker, about Ben Solo, to Rey[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

An enraged Rey proceeded to battle Skywalker with her staff, only to be swiftly disarmed[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) after stumbling over a stone,[[251]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_4-251) leading to Rey threatening him with his father's lightsaber. She revealed that, according to Kylo, Skywalker had tried to murder him while he was asleep and defenseless simply because he was afraid of his strength in the Force, sparking a duel between Uncle and Nephew. Skywalker clarified that when he had arrived at the hut, he sensed the power and darkness within his nephew and, for a brief instant of absolute pure instinct, he did intend to kill him and activated his lightsaber.. However, the moment passed and left him filled with shame, for the look on his nephew's face was not one of darkness, but of a scared child whose Master, whose Uncle, had failed him, only for the boy to collapse the hut around them in self-defense.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

Rey told Skywalker that like when he confronted his father about the light side still within him, she sensed the goodness still within Kylo Ren. Skywalker disagreed, saying that it is no longer there. Unable to convince him otherwise, Rey secretly stole the texts to teach herself later and left the planet without him to confront Kylo.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) While Rey boarded the *Millennium Falcon* to leave, Skywalker saw R2 for the last time and told him to send his best to 3PO and that he would need to stay with Rey to make sure she got back to safety.[[245]](#cite_note-TLJ:_A_Junior_Novel-245)

As Rey left Ahch-To, Luke realized the similarity between her departure and when Yoda and Kenobi insisted him to remain on Dagobah to complete his training rather than abandon to save his friends at Cloud City.[[251]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_4-251)

#### Important lesson

:   "*Luke, We are what they grow beyond. That is the true burden of all masters.*"
:   ―Yoda[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

 [![The spirit of Yoda communed with Skywalker, urging him to embrace failure as the greatest teacher.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/9e/Luke_listens_to_Yoda_TLJ.png/revision/latest?cb=20180416232606) [![The spirit of Yoda communed with Skywalker, urging him to embrace failure as the greatest teacher.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/9e/Luke_listens_to_Yoda_TLJ.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/269?cb=20180416232606)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/9e/Luke_listens_to_Yoda_TLJ.png/revision/latest?cb=20180416232606) 

The spirit of Yoda communed with Skywalker, urging him to embrace failure as the greatest teacher.

 

The following night, Skywalker returned to the tree containing the Jedi texts with the intention of burning it to the ground. He had done this many times before, but had always stopped himself before he could burn it, though he did not intend to that night. As he approached the tree, his thoughts were answered by a voice,[[251]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_4-251) and when he turned he was greeted by the spirit of his old master Yoda,[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) whom he had not seen in [decades](/wiki/Standard_decade "Standard decade") since he last saw him on Dagobah and Endor.[[245]](#cite_note-TLJ:_A_Junior_Novel-245) Skywalker affirmed his desire to burn the tree with the texts inside.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) Yoda informed him that he had no intentions of stopping him and reminded him that had never been able to prevent him from doing what he wanted.[[251]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_4-251) Skywalker began to hesitate when he attempted to set the tree on fire. Yoda instead proceeded to summon a bolt of lightning, setting the tree alight and while laughing, repelled Skywalker with the flames when he changed his mind and tried to save the texts.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

As the tree burned, the two masters sat next to each other and Yoda reminded Skywalker that he needed to heed his final instructions to him before Yoda's physical death on Dagobah, namely passing down what he had learned. Skywalker lamented over the loss of the texts, but Yoda slyly stated that although the texts held wisdom, 'page turners, they were not', and they did not contain anything Rey did not already have with her. Skywalker tried to explain that by failing Ben he felt that he had failed the Jedi. Yoda admonished Skywalker for still "constantly looking to the horizon," like he had when they met on Dagobah. Yoda explained that 'failure is the greatest teacher' and that failure was an essential part of what he had implored Skywalker to pass on so many years before.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

### Finding peace and purpose

:   "*See you around, kid.*"
:   ―Luke Skywalker's last words to Kylo Ren[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

 [![Skywalker confronted Ren by projecting his appearance on Crait, having never left Ahch-To.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ae/Luke_Duels_Kylo_Ren.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180411230457) [![Skywalker confronted Ren by projecting his appearance on Crait, having never left Ahch-To.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ae/Luke_Duels_Kylo_Ren.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/263?cb=20180411230457)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ae/Luke_Duels_Kylo_Ren.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180411230457) 

Skywalker confronted Ren by projecting his appearance on Crait, having never left Ahch-To.

 

Skywalker later appeared at the [Resistance base](/wiki/Crait_outpost "Crait outpost") on [Crait](/wiki/Crait "Crait") and greeted his sister for the first time in years, giving her Han's [gold dice](/wiki/Han_Solo%27s_dice "Han Solo's dice") to remember him by. Reconciling his failure to stop Ren and for not being there to prevent Han's death, Skywalker resolved to finally [confront Ren](/wiki/Battle_of_Crait "Battle of Crait") to buy the Resistance time to escape.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) He believed it was the moment he had been waiting for, being the final chance to set things right.[[252]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_6-252) Before Skywalker went to confront his nephew, he wordlessly greeted his old friend C-3PO.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

Stepping outside, Skywalker was spotted and targeted by a barrage of cannon fire from multiple [AT-M6](/wiki/All_Terrain_MegaCaliber_Six "All Terrain MegaCaliber Six") walkers, but when the fusillade came to a stop, Skywalker strolled out of the smoke completely unharmed.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) After Ren witnessed the impossible feat, Skywalker spoke to him in the Force, telling him that it wasn't over until it was just the two of them.[[252]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_6-252) Ren landed on the surface and approached Skywalker alone and on foot. Ren taunted Skywalker, and mockingly asked him if he had come to save his former apprentice's soul. But Skywalker acknowledged that he was not there to redeem him.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

Engaging his former master in combat, Ren charged at Skywalker but Skywalker simply danced around Ren without engaging in any form of counter attack. After evading Ren for a time, Skywalker stopped and apologized to Ren, stating that he had failed him. He also informed his former student that victory was not so certain as he believed; that the war was only beginning, and that the Jedi would continue through Rey. He then deactivated his lightsaber and offered to let Kylo strike him down, but warned him that doing so in anger would only cause him pain, just as killing Han had, and stated that in death, he would always be with his nephew.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) Unknown to Kylo, Luke had sensed that Rey had lifted all the rocks blocking the exit of the Resistance base so they could escape to fight another day.[[253]](#cite_note-The_Skywalker_Saga-253)

Ren ignored all these warnings and slashed Skywalker across the torso. Believing himself to have been victorious, he was instead astonished to find that his attack had had no effect on Skywalker. He walked over to his former master and tentatively ran him through, and discovered that Luke was not physically present; he was in fact still on Ahch-To, [projecting](/wiki/Force_projection "Force projection") an illusion of himself through the Force.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) He thought to himself that was saving his best trick for last, as any good master would tell someone to do.[[252]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_6-252) The illusion was tailored to have the maximum effect on Ren, as Luke portrayed himself as he had last appeared to his nephew before they came to blows. Likewise, he portrayed himself as wielding Anakin Skywalker's lightsaber, knowing that it would have more effect on Ren than if he had used his green blade.[[254]](#cite_note-Luke_Blue_Lightsaber-254)

 [![Ahch-To's binary sunset was the last thing Skywalker saw as he passed away into the Force.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/96/Luke_fades_into_the_Force.png/revision/latest?cb=20180731045823) [![Ahch-To's binary sunset was the last thing Skywalker saw as he passed away into the Force.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/96/Luke_fades_into_the_Force.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/270?cb=20180731045823)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/96/Luke_fades_into_the_Force.png/revision/latest?cb=20180731045823) 

Ahch-To's binary sunset was the last thing Skywalker saw as he passed away into the Force.

 

Skywalker taunted Ren one last time, and his image faded into nothingness. Light-years away, Skywalker collapsed from the mental stress necessary to sustain such a lifelike illusion, which Ren realized meant that Luke would become one with the Force. As he sat down on the cliff where he first trained Rey, Luke beheld the twin suns of Ahch-To in their final descent towards the horizon.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) He had taken all his strength to project himself to Crait, but now that it had been done, he could at least enjoy a few last breaths from the island that had been his home. Luke Skywalker knew that he was going to die, but it was something he accepted; death was the way of all things, even the stars.[[245]](#cite_note-TLJ:_A_Junior_Novel-245) Though unsure if it was real or just a memory, Skywalker heard the familiar and comforting voice of Obi-Wan Kenobi, urging him to let go, and so he did.[[247]](#cite_note-TLJ:_Expanded_Edition-247) Staring at a binary sunset on the horizon much like the one he gazed upon as a boy, Luke Skywalker—Jedi Master, ace pilot, galactic legend, and son of the Chosen One—passed away, joining his father and old masters as one with the Force with a feeling of peace and purpose.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) His final thoughts were that his life in the realm of the living had ended in the same way it began: by the light of two suns, until he stepped into a [larger world](/wiki/Netherworld_of_the_Force "Netherworld of the Force").[[252]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_6-252)

### Post-mortem

#### Reunion with Ren

:   "*Kylo Ren means nothing to me. But I'll always be there for* Ben*.*"
:   ―Luke Skywalker[[238]](#cite_note-LoV_10-238)

Kylo Ren learned of Skywalker's death from the former Jedi Grandea.[[255]](#cite_note-LoV_7-255) In the aftermath of Skywalker's death, Ren felt Skywalker in the Force, watching him. Wanting a reckoning with him, Ren traveled in search of Skywalker's "ghost" to where Skywalker had faced him on Crait, to the Jedi Outpost on Elphrona with Knights of Ren [Vicrul](/wiki/Vicrul "Vicrul") and [Ushar](/wiki/Ushar "Ushar") who both remembered facing Skywalker there, and finally to the ruins of Skywalker's Jedi Temple on Ossus. Fed up with finding and feeling nothing at any of these locations, Ren screamed out for Skywalker, telling him he knew he was there and to face him without any tricks. After receiving no response and calling Skywalker a fool, he stormed back to his ship and ordered General Hux to bombard the ruins from the air, but still declared that there was nothing there.[[256]](#cite_note-SYAK-256)

 [![As an enraged Ren found his way back to him, Skywalker kept trying to teach his nephew a few lessons.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ec/LukeAsksKyloAboutHisLife-LegacyOfVader10.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20251123034313) [![As an enraged Ren found his way back to him, Skywalker kept trying to teach his nephew a few lessons.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ec/LukeAsksKyloAboutHisLife-LegacyOfVader10.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/230?cb=20251123034313)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ec/LukeAsksKyloAboutHisLife-LegacyOfVader10.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20251123034313) 

As an enraged Ren found his way back to him, Skywalker kept trying to teach his nephew a few lessons.

 

By entering Darth Vader's meditation chamber, Ren was able to reach a plane in the Force where Skywalker resided. Standing with several other figures, including Yoda, Skywalker approached Ren as he tried to strike down another Jedi, substantiating the apparition's claim that Ren should not be there, but was nonetheless. Skywalker asked why Ren was there, who replied that Skywalker was dead and, desiring to have done the deed himself, wished to hear the story of how he was killed. Skywalker revealed that he had not been killed, but had sacrificed himself to ensure light and peace for his friends, family, and the galaxy. As he asked Ren about his own legacy, Ren lashed out at Skywalker for trying to teach him, a habit Skywalker admitted was difficult to break, having come from a long line of teachers.[[238]](#cite_note-LoV_10-238)

Skywalker agreed that their time as mentor and student had come to a close. Ren questioned why Skywalker taught Rey, to which the Jedi replied that she wanted to learn. Expressing his hate for Skywalker, Ren told the Jedi he was nothing to him, that he had failed to turn Ren into himself and lost, threatening Skywalker to leave him alone lest Ren find a way to destroy him. Skywalker told Ren that he could not destroy the Jedi without destroying the Force itself, something he would be unable to do without destroying himself, though praised the young man for having goals. Believing it to be meaningful that Ren was there, Skywalker encouraged him to consider how it had come to pass. Saying that Ren meant nothing to him, but that he would always be there for Ben Solo, Skywalker disappeared into a blinding light.[[238]](#cite_note-LoV_10-238)

#### Skywalker heir

:   "*We've passed on all we know. A thousand generations live in you now. But this is your fight.*"
:   ―The spirit of Luke Skywalker, to Rey[[17]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-17)

 [![The spirit of Luke Skywalker appeared to Rey, encouraging her to continue her Jedi path.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c5/LukeSkywalkerForceGhost-TROS.png/revision/latest?cb=20210110050551) [![The spirit of Luke Skywalker appeared to Rey, encouraging her to continue her Jedi path.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c5/LukeSkywalkerForceGhost-TROS.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210110050551)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c5/LukeSkywalkerForceGhost-TROS.png/revision/latest?cb=20210110050551) 

The spirit of Luke Skywalker appeared to Rey, encouraging her to continue her Jedi path.

 

Following his death, Leia took up Luke's mantle as Rey's Jedi mentor, and Skywalker's spirit continued to urge his sister to become one with the Force, sensing her declining health, but she persistently refused until Rey and the Resistance were ready to stand on their own.[[212]](#cite_note-TROS:_Expanded_Edition-212)

One year after becoming one with the Force, Luke spoke to Leia once more, shortly before her death, beckoning her to show her son Ben she still loved him, reminding his sister that if Vader could become Anakin again, Kylo Ren could be Ben Solo again.[[212]](#cite_note-TROS:_Expanded_Edition-212) Shortly afterwards, he sensed that Rey had discovered the truth behind her lineage and had stranded herself on Ahch-To much like he did during the final years of his life. As she threw her lightsaber into the wreckage of her ship, Luke appeared and grabbed it out of the air. Admitting that he was wrong in exiling himself, Luke consoled her that her legacy would not be defined by her bloodline but by her heart and her actions. When Rey lamented that Kylo Ren destroyed the final Sith marker that led to where the resurrected Emperor was residing, Luke mirrored the words of Yoda, stating that she had everything she needed. As a parting gift, Luke gifted Rey his sister's lightsaber and raised his old X-Wing from the depths of the ocean for Rey to use and travel to Exegol.[[17]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-17)

 [![Luke's spirit along with his sister watched over Rey from afar as she buried their Jedi weapons as tribute to the Skywalker legacy.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/14/LeiaLukeForceGhost-TSWB.png/revision/latest?cb=20220417195425) [![Luke's spirit along with his sister watched over Rey from afar as she buried their Jedi weapons as tribute to the Skywalker legacy.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/14/LeiaLukeForceGhost-TSWB.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/225?cb=20220417195425)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/14/LeiaLukeForceGhost-TSWB.png/revision/latest?cb=20220417195425) 

Luke's spirit along with his sister watched over Rey from afar as she buried their Jedi weapons as tribute to the Skywalker legacy.

 

Rey could hear Luke among the numerous voices of the Jedi of the past shortly before she received the inner strength to overcome Darth Sidious. As the girl rose from the ground, Skywalker assured her that the Force would always be with her, and after she finally destroyed the Emperor by deflecting his Force lightning using Luke's and Leia's original lightsabers, he appeared one more time with his sister on Tatooine and watched from afar as Rey buried both of the weapons at the old Lars Homestead finally albeit posthumously formally earning the title of Jedi Master with his role as her mentor completed.[[17]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-17) Having come to consider the Skywalkers her chosen family[[257]](#cite_note-TROS_JN-257) and hoping to honor her mentors,[[203]](#cite_note-Battlefront_II-203) the girl adopted the name Skywalker following Luke's statement that one's heart and actions defined one's legacy rather than one's bloodline.[[17]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-17)

### Legacy

:   "*Who did it? I want to find them, hear the story, make them tell me how you* suffered*.*"  
    "*No one killed me. I sacrificed my life for others, in service of something greater. I died for my friends and family and for people I don't know all across the galaxy, so they could live in peace and light. That's what my life was for.*"
:   ―Kylo Ren and the ghost of Luke Skywalker[[238]](#cite_note-LoV_10-238)

After his death, Skywalker's belongings, including his green lightsaber, were gathered by the Caretakers and stored with the other Jedi artifacts that they preserved alongside the temple on the Ahch-To island.[[247]](#cite_note-TLJ:_Expanded_Edition-247) The tale of Skywalker's stand against Ren and the First Order at Crait spread across the galaxy. One instance occurred on [Canto Bight](/wiki/Canto_Bight "Canto Bight"), where [Oniho Zaya](/wiki/Oniho_Zaya "Oniho Zaya") shared the story with fellow urchins [Temiri Blagg](/wiki/Temiri_Blagg "Temiri Blagg") and [Arashell Sar](/wiki/Arashell_Sar "Arashell Sar").[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)[[218]](#cite_note-TLJ_VD-218) As word of this moment spread, Skywalker's sacrifice showed others that it was possible to stand defiant against the First Order, and his legend reinvigorated a spark of hope.[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4) However, Commander [Branwayne Spiftz](/wiki/Branwayne_Spiftz "Branwayne Spiftz"), like some others in the First Order, did not believe the story of Skywalker Force-projecting himself, and even thought that the Force was not real and just a children's story. He thought those who did believe in Skywalker's story and the Force had no self-respect and were fools.[[258]](#cite_note-Spark-258)

Shortly before his death, Skywalker wrote in his book *[The Secrets of the Jedi](/wiki/The_Secrets_of_the_Jedi "The Secrets of the Jedi")* acknowledging that if perhaps he had remained active as a Jedi Master, wielding his lightsaber and actively fighting against his nephew, for the years he was in exile instead, he probably could have prevented the rise of the First Order and the destruction of the New Republic.[[216]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Jedi-216) Additionally, Skywalker's loss represented a heavy blow to the Resistance. When [Temmin Wexley](/wiki/Temmin_Wexley "Temmin Wexley") and [Karé Kun](/wiki/Kar%C3%A9_Kun "Karé Kun") informed the retired Wedge Antilles and [Norra Wexley](/wiki/Norra_Wexley "Norra Wexley") about their losses since the Battle of Crait, Antilles felt devastated upon learning of the death of his former wingmate, asking himself if the Jedi were not supposed to [live forever](/wiki/Immortality "Immortality"). A short time later,[[259]](#cite_note-Resistance_Reborn-259) Skywalker's lesson to Del Meeko, that everyone had a choice to be better,[[203]](#cite_note-Battlefront_II-203) was passed onto the Resistance by Meeko's daughter, [Zay Versio](/wiki/Zay_Versio "Zay Versio").[[259]](#cite_note-Resistance_Reborn-259)

After learning that the [Zixon](/wiki/Zixon "Zixon") on [Minfar](/wiki/Minfar "Minfar") had been saved from the Empire's [Echo Horn](/wiki/Echo_Horn "Echo Horn") weapon by someone that Zixon [Jem](/wiki/Jem "Jem") and [Lim](/wiki/Lim "Lim") only referred to and knew as their friend, Dameron suggested to Rey and [Rose Tico](/wiki/Rose_Tico "Rose Tico") that it was Luke who freed the Zixon during the time he was missing, as he fought and helped defeat the Empire. Tico latched on to the idea, but Rey, having known him, was immediately skeptical that Luke was the type of person who would spend time with the Zixon and their spritely culture, but thought if she was better at using the Force she would be able to know. However, they were mistaken and the friend was actually scientist [Glenna Kip](/wiki/Glenna_Kip "Glenna Kip"). As Rey grew with her skill in the Force, she started to believe she was nothing like Luke.[[258]](#cite_note-Spark-258)

One of the most influential people in the entire galaxy, Luke Skywalker's accomplishments were remembered for decades after the Battle of Endor. Within the annals of the Resistance, basic training would see all pilots in its [Starfighter Corps](/wiki/Resistance_Starfighter_Corps "Resistance Starfighter Corps") learning the [Skywalker Swoop](/wiki/Skywalker_Swoop "Skywalker Swoop"), which was based on Luke's piloting abilities during the Galactic Civil War.[[210]](#cite_note-TFA_VD-210) Many remembered him for destroying the Death Star and killing the Emperor,[[221]](#cite_note-Bloodline-221) and as such viewed him as a hero of mythic proportions.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) Resistance pilot Jessika Pava considered Skywalker to be the greatest X-wing pilot of all time.[[260]](#cite_note-On_the_Front_Lines-260) Some questioned whether or not Luke could have used his powers for evil,[[221]](#cite_note-Bloodline-221) while others simply viewed him as a myth.[[8]](#cite_note-Episode_VII-8) Skywalker's unlikely story of going from a simple farm boy on Tatooine to a galactic legend gave hope to restless youths on a number of worlds.[[261]](#cite_note-GEG-261)

## Personality and traits

#### Youth

:   "*This one a long time have I watched. All his life has he looked away…to the future, to the horizon. Never his mind on where he was. Hmm? What he was doing. Hmph. Adventure. Heh! Excitement. Heh! A Jedi craves not these things. You are reckless!*"
:   ―Yoda[[11]](#cite_note-Episode_V-11)

 [![Luke Skywalker was once a farm boy who longed for a more exciting life.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/23/KevinWilson-StarWars-LukeSkywalker.png/revision/latest?cb=20231127040222) [![Luke Skywalker was once a farm boy who longed for a more exciting life.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/23/KevinWilson-StarWars-LukeSkywalker.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20231127040222)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/23/KevinWilson-StarWars-LukeSkywalker.png/revision/latest?cb=20231127040222) 

Luke Skywalker was once a farm boy who longed for a more exciting life.

 

In his youth, Skywalker was often curious, impatient, looking ahead to the future with little regard for his present surroundings, and even a bit brash.[[245]](#cite_note-TLJ:_A_Junior_Novel-245) Like his father, he was impulsive, reckless, and often had little regard for his own personal safety.[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-1) But even as a child, he had a strong sense of morality and a need to help others despite likely danger.[[31]](#cite_note-SW7-31) He believed his aunt Beru was a sweet person in every part of her being.[[133]](#cite_note-Luke_on_the_Bright_Side-133) Some time after the Battle of Yavin, he would confer with Nakari Kelen that he regretted his behavior before then, acknowledging he complained "about everything" because of his desire to escape from Tatooine. He also acknowledged his scarce talent at lying,[[54]](#cite_note-HttJ-54) a trait that many people could infer.[[68]](#cite_note-SW8-68) He once confided in Leia that he felt Tatooine had never felt like a home to him,[[94]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_33-94) and did not like to be seen as just a farm boy[[89]](#cite_note-The_Screaming_Citadel_1-89) though later took pride in where he came from and his past.[[102]](#cite_note-Storms_of_Crait-102)[[132]](#cite_note-Squad_Goals_1-132) He was annoyed by both Solo and Aphra calling him "kid."[[89]](#cite_note-The_Screaming_Citadel_1-89)

He struggled with anger and feelings of wanting revenge, especially toward Queen Trios because she had betrayed the Alliance, despite knowing they could be dangerous for someone who used the Force. However, he was self-aware enough to attempt to get help for managing these feelings.[[118]](#cite_note-SW62-118) While working for the Alliance, he got annoyed when he was assigned missions that he considered menial.[[102]](#cite_note-Storms_of_Crait-102) He could be paranoid of getting caught by Imperials and did not want to take risks when it was not needed. When he held one of the lightsabers of Darth Atrius, Skywalker was overcome by incredible rage, which one even caused an episode where he dissociated from his body and killed many stormtroopers. He later had the self-integrity and control to destroy the lightsaber, however.[[58]](#cite_note-SWA4-58) Similarly, when controlled by an Abersyn symbiote, Skywalker became obsessed with power and dominating others, but eventually rejected the raw power that the Rur crystal suggested it could offer because he would not truly be like a Jedi and have their freedom.[[9]](#cite_note-Aphra_8-9) He was somewhat traumatized by his experience with Grakkus the Hutt and became weary of those that were very interested in the Jedi.[[90]](#cite_note-SW_31-90)

 [![Luke Skywalker after the Battle of Yavin](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/cb/LukeSkywalker-ANH.png/revision/latest?cb=20130313222024) [![Luke Skywalker after the Battle of Yavin](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/cb/LukeSkywalker-ANH.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20130313222024)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/cb/LukeSkywalker-ANH.png/revision/latest?cb=20130313222024) 

Luke Skywalker after the Battle of Yavin

 

After everything they went through at the Battle of Yavin, Skywalker took pride in his membership of Red Squadron and found kinship with them, but did not love the attention and honor he received for being the one to take the final shot. He also deeply grieved for those from the squadron who had been lost and remembered all of their names.
