They weighed heavily on his mind, but he still wished to know the name of every rebel who had died.[[103]](#cite_note-SW45-103) He especially remembered and looked up to Jyn Erso and the rest of Rogue One, taking to heart their belief in going rogue to do what was right, and naming Rogue Squadron after them.[[109]](#cite_note-SW52-109) However, he still retained a sense of confidence and excitement about the Alliance's chances of beating the Empire[[110]](#cite_note-SW50-110) and surviving the Death Star gave him greater confidence that he would survive other events.[[111]](#cite_note-SW51-111) He became determined to take down the Empire, and determined to become a Jedi in order to do so despite the risk.[[125]](#cite_note-SW70-125) Upon becoming leader of Rogue Squadron, Skywalker came to believe that it was the best team in the galaxy.[[131]](#cite_note-Squad_Goals_2-131)

#### Trials of the self and the Force

Over the course of his Jedi journey, Skywalker would rely on people, like Leia Organa, Han Solo, and Chewbacca, among others.[[262]](#cite_note-Worldwide_224-262) In the immediate aftermath of losing his hand, Skywalker was incredibly distraught and haunted by traumatic flashbacks of the events on Cloud City, what he had lost, and what Vader revealed to him. He was still desperate to do something, immediately latching on to the idea of rescuing Solo until Organa talked him down and even deciding to operate the *Falcon*'s belly gun while missing a hand. During this time he was desperate for guidance, consumed by anger and fear, and questioned if he should even be a Jedi.[[142]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_1_2020-142) He initially did not even want to get a prosthetic hand, because he felt it made him feel less like himself and more like Vader.[[143]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_2-143)

Overall, as his skills in the Force progressed, and especially after losing a hand to Darth Vader, Skywalker became more patient and seasoned.[[201]](#cite_note-The_Princess_and_the_Scoundrel-201) He was often seen as having wisdom beyond his years.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-12)[[48]](#cite_note-weapon-jedi-48) He came to decisively accept his path as a Jedi and started to understand that having a lightsaber did not define him as a Jedi and that being one was about using the Force to bring light to the galaxy.[[146]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_4_2020-146) He held on to Yoda's teachings and repeated them to try and focus and overcome obstacles.[[147]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_5_2020-147) He stayed committed to his path as a Jedi, determined to help a suffering galaxy, even when Verla tried to dissuade him from it by revealing what it cost her. He also was inspired by a seeing an old Jedi outpost and was determined to fight for what was right no matter the risk just like they did.[[148]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_6_2020-148) He felt the Force flow through his being as a whole and did not localize it, meaning the loss of his hand did not physically limit him.[[189]](#cite_note-Dark_Droids_2-189)

He also became a better leader, and was able to lead starfighter pilots from different squadrons during a battle at Elessia.[[150]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_8-150) He took things that were important to him very seriously, and was irritated when Aphra attempted to turn something important to him into a joke.[[182]](#cite_note-Aphra_2020_33-182) He started to warn against cockiness and advocated for having a level head.[[132]](#cite_note-Squad_Goals_1-132)[[131]](#cite_note-Squad_Goals_2-131) He developed more confidence in himself and in the Force, and when he focused on it became more capable.[[126]](#cite_note-SW71-126) He also once declared his love of sand when he ended up a on a beach after nearly drowning.[[147]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_5_2020-147)

After discovering an ancient Jedi text, Skywalker became determined and committed to studying it and used the rare free time he had to do so instead of relaxing. However, he still often doubted his abilities despite others believing in him[[172]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_29-172) and his attempts to affirm himself in his abilities,[[175]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_30-175) and started to believe that without the text he would never become a Jedi.[[174]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_31-174) Despite this, he would still encourage his friends and affirm their abilities[[175]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_30-175) and valued teamwork tremendously.[[132]](#cite_note-Squad_Goals_1-132)

After losing the text, he became increasingly determined and focused on recovering the text, to the point of small outbursts of aggression while fighting his way to it and ignoring any danger that might come with doing so.[[174]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_31-174) His self-doubt continued to evolve into feeling like he would never truly be able to become a Jedi, leaving him wanting to take control of his life and take action.[[184]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_34-184) As one of the only Jedi left, he also suffered from loneliness in that aspect, wishing there were others. He also feared that he was useless and would not be able to save people, and[[182]](#cite_note-Aphra_2020_33-182) wrongly[[201]](#cite_note-The_Princess_and_the_Scoundrel-201) worried Organa viewed him as pathetic[[182]](#cite_note-Aphra_2020_33-182) and did not want to disappoint her.[[58]](#cite_note-SWA4-58)

Before meeting Yoda, Skywalker was desperate for a teacher in the Force and dreamed of being able to do all the things Kenobi had been able to.[[123]](#cite_note-SW_68-123) Because of this, Skywalker was quick to go along with Aphra's plan to go with her to the Screaming Citadel because of the promise of a Jedi teacher and learning Jedi knowledge despite his knowledge of Aphra's untrustworthiness.[[89]](#cite_note-The_Screaming_Citadel_1-89) He eventually rejected the Rur crystal because he recognized that it was not a Jedi in practice and belief and only in knowledge, and came to realize that he could not take shortcuts like Aphra did to get what he wanted and urged her to stay away.[[9]](#cite_note-Aphra_8-9) He also immediately trusted and begged for training from Werla Calip when she said she knew the Force despite having no proof of this,[[125]](#cite_note-SW70-125) and started to believe that signs Calip was not what she seemed and her beliefs were not morally sound was Calip testing him. This naivete led to Calip stealing his lightsaber from him.[[127]](#cite_note-SW72-127) When she revealed that she did not know the Force and her trainings were empty, Skywalker believed that there was more to her than it seemed.[[129]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_74-129)

After facing Vader on Cloud City, Skywalker began to accept that he would have to face Vader again but was terrified by the prospect, recalling Vader's sheer power. He hoped that he could tap into great power and defeat him, but doubted he could, and was haunted by imagining himself facing Darth Vader again in his current state and being killed by the Sith Lord. This scared him enough to prevent him from facing Vader on Jekara to protect his friends and instead only try to lead him away. His fear also prevented him from being able to reach the Force consistently or speak to Kenobi, contributing to his feelings of loneliness and sense that he was not ready.[[159]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_16_2020-159) Despite not wanting to face Vader on Jekara, he remained confident that he would become a Jedi and confront him one day.[[163]](#cite_note-War_of_the_Bounty_Hunters_5-163)

Even after training with Yoda, his loneliness grew, and he became frustrated with Yoda for not responding to him and answering him through the Force.[[185]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_35-185) He enthusiastically and desperately wanted to search for old Jedi temples and outposts to learn more about the Order.[[152]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_13_2020-152) He eventually decided that while he was grateful for what Yoda taught him, he would rather just learn from his text.[[185]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_35-185) In the end, however, he would decide to return to Yoda to complete his training.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-12) According to Yoda, when he arrived he had developed a clear "gaping need" for a connection to his father and to have a family.[[194]](#cite_note-Masters-194) While he did demand answers as for whether Vader was his father and wanted to know why it was "unfortunate" for him to know, he was saddened by the news that Yoda was passing.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-12) Skywalker promised Organa he could train her as Yoda trained him.[[201]](#cite_note-The_Princess_and_the_Scoundrel-201)

#### Growing values and beliefs

Despite all he went through, Skywalker still retained his idealistic viewpoint, willing to think the best of anyone,[[54]](#cite_note-HttJ-54) and believing that Vader was redeemable.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-12) Despite not thinking so immediately, Skywalker still believed that Doctor Aphra was a good person and her friend despite her prior service to the Empire, and went out of his way to save her life. He believed that she would see sense when it came to her belief in the Empire and was convinced that she could move past the bad things she had went through to be a better person like Solo had.[[91]](#cite_note-Aphra_7-91) He wanted to make a difference in the galaxy however he could in ways both big and small[[102]](#cite_note-Storms_of_Crait-102) and believed that you could accomplish many things with just the help of one's friends.[[130]](#cite_note-SW75-130) He grew to truly believe that anything was possible.[[189]](#cite_note-Dark_Droids_2-189)

He was also unable to ignore those who needed help, sometimes to the point of endangering missions for the sake of saving someone else's life, as his father would throughout the Clone Wars.[[14]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_1-14)[[54]](#cite_note-HttJ-54) He was dedicated to saving lives, and once stood up to General Dodonna to convince him to save others even at their own expense.[[114]](#cite_note-SW54-114) Even when he knew he likely could not beat Vader, he still went to help his friends against him,[[129]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_74-129) and was brave enough to fight him and put himself in danger so that his friends Chewbacca and R2-D2 could escape and live.[[130]](#cite_note-SW75-130) He was willing to risk important equipment to save the lives of Kes Dameron and Shara Bey.[[134]](#cite_note-AEoV-134) He was willing to help save Lando Calrissian at a time when they did not know each other well even though Skywalker did not trust him and was struggling with using the Force.[[143]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_2-143)

 [![As both a Jedi and Rebel Alliance fighter, Luke Skywalker wanted to help the people around him and those across the galaxy.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ed/Displate-LukeXWing.png/revision/latest?cb=20250727025628) [![As both a Jedi and Rebel Alliance fighter, Luke Skywalker wanted to help the people around him and those across the galaxy.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ed/Displate-LukeXWing.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20250727025628)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ed/Displate-LukeXWing.png/revision/latest?cb=20250727025628) 

As both a Jedi and Rebel Alliance fighter, Luke Skywalker wanted to help the people around him and those across the galaxy.

 

Throughout his life, Skywalker had always been filled with a need to be helpful and recognized that that need had steered him toward fighting with the Rebel Alliance.[[133]](#cite_note-Luke_on_the_Bright_Side-133) Organa even thought he could be neurotic about always wanting to be out in the fight and on the front lines.[[112]](#cite_note-SW55-112) He was incredibly sympathetic to those in need and wanted to help them even when other's around him did not.[[89]](#cite_note-The_Screaming_Citadel_1-89) He helped others in need immediately and without question even if he did not know them, like he did with Werla Calip,[[124]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_69-124) and later tried to convince her to go on a mission and take action with him to save many lives[[125]](#cite_note-SW70-125)[[128]](#cite_note-SW73-128) which was successful.[[129]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_74-129) His faith in her turned out to be justified as she later helped the Alliance and saved his life.[[130]](#cite_note-SW75-130) He continued to always believe in an encourage others, especially his friends,[[131]](#cite_note-Squad_Goals_2-131) and his faith that Aphra had good in her was also somewhat proven right when she helped hide Echo Base from the Empire.[[135]](#cite_note-Aphra_Epilogue-135)

He also had a strong sense of justice, and was determined to make Ajax Sigma answer for the people he killed,[[178]](#cite_note-Revelations_1-178) but on a smaller scale repeatedly and fiercely stood up to Urtya on the behalf of Organa and Lee-Char.[[104]](#cite_note-SW44-104)[[106]](#cite_note-SW48-106) He believed that the Partisans plan to kill millions on Shu-Torun as payback to the Empire was not just or fair,[[120]](#cite_note-SW65-120) and was even willing to sacrifice his life if it meant they would not be able to do it.[[121]](#cite_note-SW66-121) He was willing to go against direct orders from a superior if he believed he was doing what was right.[[111]](#cite_note-SW51-111) He was against killing, once telling Verla that he did not kill defenseless and certainly not unconscious people, which was why he did not try to kill her even though she tried to kill him.[[148]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_6_2020-148) He became frustrated with Partisans unnecessarily taking lives,[[117]](#cite_note-SW64-117) and even did not want to even speak to or interact with Gretta after she killed several people upon their meeting.[[184]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_34-184)

He was incredibly kind and reassuring, even to droids,[[110]](#cite_note-SW50-110) and especially kind to kids, and was considerate towards one named Forvan he had just met while in No-Space and was concerned for his well-being.[[175]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_30-175) When the boy started to believe that Skywalker would save him from being trapped in No-Space, Skywalker was sure to not get his hopes up, but still assured the boy that he would do everything he could to try to free them and help them, demonstrating his unconditional care for others.[[174]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_31-174) Skywalker cared deeply for his friends, and could intuitively tell when something was bothering Organa or she was not acting like herself.[[157]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_14_2020-157) Doctor Aphra believed he was good of heart, though in her opinion he was too good.[[179]](#cite_note-Aphra_2020_32-179) He told her that he was committed to helping protect her from Vader because it was what Jedi did. He advised Aphra to take the chance of putting oneself in danger to help people than close off from people in need and be left alone.[[183]](#cite_note-Aphra_2020_34-183) After the Battle on Epikonia, he willingly stayed behind with Organa, wanting to help the people affected by the Scourge there. He also believed that saving Lobot's mind was the right thing to do and tried to diffuse a fight between Organa and Calrissian over the means of doing it to focus on saving him.[[187]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_41-187)

#### Jedi Knight and Master

:   "*I'm glad we were brought together, Del.*"  
    "*So, what happens now? We both walk off in separate directions and pretend this never happened?*"  
    "*I don't think you can. There's still conflict in you.*"  
    "*Of course there's conflict in me. I'm not blind. I know what the Empire is capable of. But what else is there?*"  
    "*A choice.*"  
    "*The Rebellion?*"  
    "*No. A choice to be better. May the Force be with you.*"
:   ―Luke Skywalker and Del Meeko[[203]](#cite_note-Battlefront_II-203)

Leia Organa took note of Skywalker's change into a calmer man as he became a Jedi Knight, thinking of the change in regard to the years that had past: while he was somewhat like other rebels who had joined the fight hopeful, only for those rebels to become jaded over the course of the war, Organa noticed a much deeper stillness within him. While she knew he was the same person, she did nearly mourn the loss of Skywalker's innocent optimism and excitement. All the same, she saw how forgiving Skywalker was towards their father and pondered how it was possible for him to not hate Vader the way she did; Skywalker tried to tell her about Anakin Skywalker's redemption to the light, but she refused to listen. Skywalker was incredibly happy for his sister and Solo's marriage. He also offered to train her in the ways of the Force, thinking they could be wonderful together as Jedi Knights, and gave her a chance to come with him on his hunt for information about the Jedi of the past. While he did not see it as Organa needing to chose between a life with Solo or a life as a Jedi, Organa did and declined.[[201]](#cite_note-The_Princess_and_the_Scoundrel-201)

Following the end of the Empire and the death of the Sith Order, Skywalker came to have great hope for the future of the Jedi, coming to believe that if a single Jedi could help bring back balance to the Force, then a restored Jedi Order perhaps could maintain that achieved peace and prevent the dark side of the Force from ever regaining its hold on [the galaxy](/wiki/The_galaxy "The galaxy"). This belief led Luke to scour worlds for the remaining Jedi texts and gathered a new class of apprentices under his tutelage.[[216]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Jedi-216) Furthermore, when he encountered the Imperial Special Forces trooper Del Meeko, he left the man with the lesson that all he needed to do was be better,[[203]](#cite_note-Battlefront_II-203) a lesson that would be passed onto Meeko's daughter, Zay Versio, and the Resistance.[[259]](#cite_note-Resistance_Reborn-259)

During his brief time as Grogu's master, Luke had to suppress his more sentimental side and be more professional in an effort to successfully pass on the Jedi values to the child.[[229]](#cite_note-Comes_a_Stranger-229) Skywalker became confident in his abilities as a Jedi Master, all while he became perceived by the galaxy as a legend. He was confident that he could take down seven Knights of Ren on his own, and expressed to them that he was superior at using the Force than them, even slightly taunting them and predicting that they would leave crying. This confidence was justified, as he did successfully defeat them. He also cared deeply for his nephew Ben Solo, and was happy when Solo joined him on missions. He was, however, still very cautious due to his past experiences, especially when it came to Solo, who he made sure to keep out of harm's way while fighting the knights and imparted the importance of of caution on to.[[233]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_2-233)

#### Later life

:   "*I failed. Because I was Luke Skywalker. Jedi Master. A legend.*"  
    "*The galaxy may need a legend.*"
:   ―Luke Skywalker and Rey[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

 [![In his later years, Skywalker lived in exile as a grief-ridden and embittered hermit.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/92/LukeSkywalkerJediHermit-SWBC43.png/revision/latest?cb=20240106204250) [![In his later years, Skywalker lived in exile as a grief-ridden and embittered hermit.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/92/LukeSkywalkerJediHermit-SWBC43.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20240106204250)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/92/LukeSkywalkerJediHermit-SWBC43.png/revision/latest?cb=20240106204250) 

In his later years, Skywalker lived in exile as a grief-ridden and embittered hermit.

 

After Ben Solo, his nephew, betrayed him and killed most of his apprentices, Skywalker became embittered as well as grief-ridden and chose to exile himself to the planet Ahch-To, where he would spend the rest of his life in with the intention of dying where the Jedi began to forever end the Jedi.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) Despite all of this, he still comforted Chewbacca when he learned of Han Solo's death, and became even more riddled with guilt.[[246]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_1-246) He also became more cautious in teaching others of immense power due to Solo's betrayal, feeling finished with the Jedi Order,[[263]](#cite_note-TLJ_Read-Along_Storybook_&_CD-263) as evidenced by when he initially regarded Rey as a delusional child,[[246]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_1-246) initially refused to train her, and when he would later decide to abruptly end their lessons after seeing her drawn towards the dark side.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) Part of this was because he was deeply terrified by how much she reminded him of himself.[[249]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_2-249) He also now believed that there was no hope for those who fell to the dark side, as shown when he openly expressed that he believed there was no hope for Kylo Ren to return to the light.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) By this point, Skywalker had come to regard Ren as his responsibility and his greatest failure.[[216]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Jedi-216) However, Rey helped him realize that in disconnecting himself from the Force, he had abandoned those he loved in selfish pity, which he was determined to rectify.[[250]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_3-250)

However, after Yoda's spirit encouraged him that Rey was the Jedi's hope, Skywalker finally realized his wrongs and chose to help the Resistance. Despite his lost faith in his nephew, Skywalker showed great remorse for failing to stop his fall to the dark side, and for himself ending up being the turning point in Solo's fall.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19) Skywalker realized that instead of blaming himself, he blamed the Jedi for his failures. His belief of the Jedi being romanticized deities with a legacy of failure remained, but gained realization that if one stripped away the sacred temples, lightsabers, and even the legends about them, they were just good people the galaxy needed.[[216]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Jedi-216) In the end, Skywalker willingly sacrificed himself for the Jedi to be revived and the Resistance to live on. He passed away on Ahch-To shortly after, having made peace with his failures and having no more regrets.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

#### Romances

Based on observing Owen and Beru Lars, Skywalker grew up believing in showing his love to people rather than telling them. When he and Nakari Kelen fell in love, he demonstrated his feelings for her, but he did not tell her how he felt; he regretted that as grieved for her death alongside the then-recent losses of his aunt, uncle, and Obi-Wan Kenobi.[[54]](#cite_note-HttJ-54) While stranded on [Hubin](/wiki/Hubin "Hubin"), Skywalker was instantly smitten with [Tula Markona](/wiki/Tula_Markona "Tula Markona")[[264]](#cite_note-SW57-264) and they shared a kiss,[[265]](#cite_note-SW60-265) but it would be a one-time event. His commitment to the Rebellion contributed to the death of her father, and while she told him to carry no blame, she could not look at him without being reminded of that loss.[[266]](#cite_note-SW61-266) When he mentioned he previously had a brief attraction to Chelli Lona Aphra, Aphra's ex-girlfriend, Sana Starros told him to count himself lucky that Aphra was not interested in men.[[89]](#cite_note-The_Screaming_Citadel_1-89) Skywalker and Reyé Hollis each appreciated the other man's smile and pleasantly-scented hair.[[133]](#cite_note-Luke_on_the_Bright_Side-133)

## Powers and abilities

### Lightsaber abilities

:   "*I see you have constructed a new lightsaber. Your skills are complete.*"
:   ―Darth Vader to Luke Skywalker[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-12)

 [![Skywalker was an accomplished duelist who triumphed over his father, Darth Vader.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/60/Return_of_the_jedi_4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20120114000618) [![Skywalker was an accomplished duelist who triumphed over his father, Darth Vader.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/60/Return_of_the_jedi_4.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/195?cb=20120114000618)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/60/Return_of_the_jedi_4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20120114000618) 

Skywalker was an accomplished duelist who triumphed over his father, Darth Vader.

 

Though he received little formal training, Luke Skywalker had a natural talent for lightsaber combat.[[11]](#cite_note-Episode_V-11) Luke's initial training with the weapon of the Jedi came during a brief session with Obi-Wan Kenobi and a training remote on the way to Alderaan,[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-1) where he learned the initial position and the four defensive postures.[[48]](#cite_note-weapon-jedi-48) Though his level proved inadequate during his first, brief duel against Darth Vader on Cymoon 1,[[63]](#cite_note-SW2-63) his combat skills had improved for their duel on Bespin,[[11]](#cite_note-Episode_V-11) and culminated with him besting the Sith Lord in combat during the Battle of Endor.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-12)

Like most Jedi, Skywalker was adept at redirecting blaster fire,[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-1)[[54]](#cite_note-HttJ-54)[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-12) and eventually was able to do it while flipping.[[126]](#cite_note-SW71-126) During his [mission](/wiki/Mission_to_Rodia_(Luke_Skywalker) "Mission to Rodia (Luke Skywalker)") to Rodia, he tried his hand at [Jar'Kai](/wiki/Jar%27Kai "Jar'Kai") for the first time with his and Huulik's lightsaber. Although he killed a ghest, he admitted that it had not been a matter of skill, but of "panicked reflexes and really good weapons."[[54]](#cite_note-HttJ-54) He received further training from the "Gamemaster," a servant of Grakkus the Hutt, who had learned the art of lightsaber combat. Forced to fight him and the Hutt's MagnaGuards, Skywalker improved his cursory abilities.[[71]](#cite_note-SW10-71) He was able to fight and defeat Kreel of SCAR Squadron in lightsaber combat, with help from utilizing his surroundings,[[102]](#cite_note-Storms_of_Crait-102) and could easily take down Imperial droids.[[126]](#cite_note-SW71-126)

After a brief time of training with Yoda, Skywalker revealed himself to be a gifted duelist on Bespin. Skywalker engaged Vader in a fierce duel and managed to hold his own for much of the duel, wounding Vader in the shoulder, impressing the Dark Lord with his skill, though Vader ultimately bested his son and cut off his hand, proving his superiority.[[11]](#cite_note-Episode_V-11) After recovering from his loss to Vader, Luke defeated the spirit of Grand Inquisitor in a duel on Tempes. The Inquisitor insulted his lightsaber ability and suggested that he fought like a child, but Skywalker was still able to defeat him.[[148]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_6_2020-148)

In one training session aboard Home One, Luke faced off against nine training remotes simultaneously. He easily destroyed the remotes in quick succession, finishing the last one off while in the middle of a conversation with C-3PO.[[152]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_13_2020-152) However, when he attempted to fight killdroids with his lightsaber while in No-Space, he first believed that the droids were resistant to lightsabers,[[175]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_30-175) before realizing that they were not resistant, he just had not been focused and one with the Force. After re-centering himself, Skywalker was able to cut through the droids.[[176]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_32-176) He also successfully defeated the droid Ajax Sigma using a lightsaber, though the droid escaped.[[178]](#cite_note-Revelations_1-178) He also fought many droids on Epikonia and was able to take many down with his lightsaber by consistently focusing on staying calm and concentrating on the Force.[[187]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_41-187)

Skywalker showed his abilities in battle during the rescue of Han Solo, where a skirmish ensued in which the Jedi killed many guards aboard the execution skiff and Jabba's sail barge. Skywalker also utilized his abilities on Endor, blocking laser fire from a scout trooper on a speeder bike before causing the trooper to crash after severing off the speeder's front stabilizers. Later, on board the second Death Star, Skywalker showed his improved abilities and was finally able to duel Vader on an even footing. However, his unwillingness to fight his own father partly held him back; but when Vader threatened to turn Leia to the dark side, an enraged Skywalker unleashed all of his raw ability, overwhelming and defeating the Sith Lord.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-12)

 [![Skywalker continued to hone his lightsaber skills.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/96/Luke_Lightsaber_Boba_Fett_Chapter_6.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20220206183640) [![Skywalker continued to hone his lightsaber skills.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/96/Luke_Lightsaber_Boba_Fett_Chapter_6.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/173?cb=20220206183640)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/96/Luke_Lightsaber_Boba_Fett_Chapter_6.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20220206183640) 

Skywalker continued to hone his lightsaber skills.

 

Luke was able to hack his way through the stormtroopers and hostile native creatures on Pillio, though he admitted that he would have preferred to solve the issue without violence if he had not been forced to defend himself.[[203]](#cite_note-Battlefront_II-203) During his rescue of Grogu from Moff Gideon, Skywalker easily destroyed a platoon of Dark Troopers with his lightsaber and the Force.[[18]](#cite_note-Chapter_16-18) Later in life, Skywalker taught multiple students in the art of lightsaber combat, including his nephew Ben Solo,[[225]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_3-225) who would later become his strongest student and destroy his Jedi Order.[[20]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_1-20) During Ben's training, Skywalker encountered and effortlessly overpowered the Knights of Ren, seamlessly dodging their attacks and destroying their weapons before using the Force to disarm them.[[233]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_2-233) When Luke dueled Exim Panshard, he discovered that his skills with a blade far surpassed those of the ancient Sith Lord. Luke easily defeated the Sith despite restraining himself to avoid harming Panshard's host Kiza.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7)

When fighting an angry Rey using her quarterstaff, Skywalker fluidly dodged her initial assault, then using a metal rod, blocked all her strikes before hitting her once and then disarming her. Later, on Crait, Luke proved his superiority in skill over Kylo Ren as well by avoiding all of Ren's attacks without even needing to use his lightsaber to block, distracting the First Order long enough for the remaining members of the Resistance to escape.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

### Force powers

:   "*I am one man. But I am not alone. The Force is my ally. And it is* Powerful*. You're* clumsy*. Untrained.* You use the dark side like a hammer*. But the Light is a* blade*. And so am I.*"
:   ―Luke Skywalker, to the Knights of Ren[[233]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_2-233)

 [![Skywalker had the power to project his image across the galaxy, albeit with fatal consequences.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f1/Luke_Skywalker_on_Crait.png/revision/latest?cb=20180425021721) [![Skywalker had the power to project his image across the galaxy, albeit with fatal consequences.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f1/Luke_Skywalker_on_Crait.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/235?cb=20180425021721)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f1/Luke_Skywalker_on_Crait.png/revision/latest?cb=20180425021721) 

Skywalker had the power to project his image across the galaxy, albeit with fatal consequences.

 

Like his father, Skywalker possessed a uniquely powerful connection to the Force, and became one of the most powerful Force wielders in galactic history. Indeed, Darth Sidious feared Skywalker and believed that he was strong enough in the Force to destroy the Sith.[[11]](#cite_note-Episode_V-11) Most of Luke's understanding of the Force came from his own research, exploration, and experience as he only had a few days Kenobi's mentorship before his demise, Yoda's one year of mentorship before he died of old age, and Kenobi's sporadic guidance from beyond the Netherworld of the Force.[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-1)[[48]](#cite_note-weapon-jedi-48)[[14]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_1-14)[[11]](#cite_note-Episode_V-11)

After learning the basics of the Force, he quickly learned how to [sense](/wiki/Force_sense "Force sense") through it,[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-1) and took the habit of opening himself to the Force in hopes of learning more than Kenobi had told him, and becoming aware of his surroundings.[[54]](#cite_note-HttJ-54)[[14]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_1-14) In time, he would also learn to sense the presence of his father, and telepathically calling his sister.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-12)[[11]](#cite_note-Episode_V-11) He was capable of seeing and hearing those who had become one with the Force.[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-1)[[11]](#cite_note-Episode_V-11)[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-12) By using the Force during the Battle of Yavin, he managed to destroy the Death Star with a shot that many thought was impossible.[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-1)

After obtaining [Huulik's lightsaber](/wiki/Huulik%27s_lightsaber "Huulik's lightsaber") and dismantling it to know his inner workings, Skywalker surmised on his own that the Force could be used to manipulate matter in the manner of telekinesis and managed to learn how to move small objects, such as a noodle or a fork.[[54]](#cite_note-HttJ-54) However, he struggled to use telekinesis on command[[90]](#cite_note-SW_31-90) but could do it in moments of great danger and emotion.[[89]](#cite_note-The_Screaming_Citadel_1-89) He also struggled with reaching out and locating things or people at this time.[[124]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_69-124) While under the influence of an Abersyn symbiote, he gained incredible psychic power that he started to use to fight the Queen of Ktath'atn in a mindscape before rejecting the power that it and the Rur crystal offered.[[9]](#cite_note-Aphra_8-9)

By the time of the Battle of Hoth, Skywalker had the ability to pull his lightsaber to his hands, though not without difficulty. Under Yoda's training, this ability was further developed, enabling him to levitate several objects at once while meditating.[[11]](#cite_note-Episode_V-11) Shortly after the revelation that Darth Vader was his father, Luke Skywalker struggled with using the Force and could not reach out to Kenobi. When consumed by anger and fear over what he had learned and lost, he lashed out with the Force, hurtling a squadron of Tie Fighters into each other. In another outburst, he accidentally cracked the window of a starship while desperately trying and failing to contact Yoda.[[142]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_1_2020-142) However, he regained his connection when he tried to reach out for his lightsaber and had a vision of Verla and that Organa was in trouble. He then was able to deactivate many carbonite blocks with people inside all at once with the Force and free them.[[146]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_4_2020-146) He was able to use the Force to anticipate and avoid many booby traps set by Verla in a cave. He was also able to hold back water flooding in to a trap from the ocean with the Force long enough to convince Verla to deactivate it.[[147]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_5_2020-147) Despite his connection to the Force still being somewhat unreliable,[[159]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_16_2020-159) Vader sensed that Skywalker's strength and connection in the Force had grown significantly.[[162]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_17_2020-162)

Skywalker eventually learned other uses, such as mind control techniques and the [mind trick](/wiki/Mind_trick "Mind trick").[[267]](#cite_note-Episode_VI_junior_novel-267) He could use the Force to influence and [control creatures](/wiki/Taming_beasts "Taming beasts")[[169]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_28-169) and was able to use it to sense others' emotions and intentions.[[175]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_30-175) He was also proficient in being able to hurl foes away, or [damage all nearby foes](/wiki/Force_repulse "Force repulse").[[203]](#cite_note-Battlefront_II-203) Luke could use the Force to make great leaps.[[11]](#cite_note-Episode_V-11) When large amounts of death occurred, he could also sense it as a disturbance in the Force.[[178]](#cite_note-Revelations_1-178) When visibility was limited, Skywalker could use the Force to help him navigate in a ship.[[179]](#cite_note-Aphra_2020_32-179)

After the activation of the [Fermata Cage](/wiki/Fermata_Cage "Fermata Cage"), Skywalker's abilities in the Force became more difficult, beginning as just being unsure that he could perform a mind trick,[[172]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_29-172) but becoming more unwieldy when he was trapped in [No-Space](/wiki/No-Space "No-Space"). When trying to use the Force to catch Lando Calrissian when he fell, Skywalker thought that he did not do it as quick as he normally could have and felt distracted by ripples in the Force.[[175]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_30-175) Later, after pushing dangerous droids away from Chewbacca, he unusually felt like he would not be able to do so again.[[176]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_32-176) During this time, he could perform a massive Force push that acted as a wave, a feat believed he would not have been able to do without the weirdness of the Force at the time, but one that allowed him to push all of the killdroids on the Hall out into space[[177]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_33-177) and later destroy large crystal guardians.[[179]](#cite_note-Aphra_2020_32-179) The first time he performed this feat, it caused him to pass out,[[177]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_33-177) and he felt like he was going to pass out after the second time, though he did not.[[179]](#cite_note-Aphra_2020_32-179) After he first performed it, Skywalker struggled to just pull and object toward him with the Force, and he felt its power go in and out like waves.[[177]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_33-177) Some examples of this were when he tried to calm a massive creature on Christophsis, but suddenly felt unable to touch the Force at all,[[184]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_34-184) and when he could not feel the Force when he attempted to open Sason Temple.[[179]](#cite_note-Aphra_2020_32-179) It could also cause him to not use the Force in the way he intended, such as when he tried to hold a [Starweird](/wiki/Starweird "Starweird") still and instead impaled it with many crystals.[[183]](#cite_note-Aphra_2020_34-183)

In the [Sason Temple](/wiki/Sason_Temple "Sason Temple"), Skywalker could hear and sense the frequency produced by [Kythoo's Bell](/wiki/Kythoo%27s_Bell "Kythoo's Bell") and its emitter in the Force. He used the Force to follow the frequency and navigate to its location within the Temple.[[182]](#cite_note-Aphra_2020_33-182) He could later use the Force to activate said emitter. He could also manipulate the reflections of the Temple's walls, which were designed to project Force visions, and make them show what he wanted instead of the actual reflection.[[183]](#cite_note-Aphra_2020_34-183)

Prior to the Battle of Endor, Skywalker once attempted to purify a red kyber crystal at the direction of Cuata and Gretta, but he failed and merely had a vision of a Sith lord before temporarily being sent to a different dimension of the Force and seeing Vader. He was later able to connect to a raw kyber crystal, which turned green and allowed him to speak with Yoda, but the unsteadiness of the Force at that time left him trapped in his vision until Yoda helped him realize that just like the sun did not disappear during the night, the Force would also always be there. Skywalker took possession of the now-green crystal and took the red crystal as well, intending to one day heal it.[[185]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_35-185)

Years later, during his rescue of Grogu, Skywalker used the Force to destroy Dark Troopers by throwing them off ledges, pushing them away, smashing crates into them/flinging debris at them, and crushing them with the Force.[[18]](#cite_note-Chapter_16-18)

Skywalker was skilled at doing [mind tricks](/wiki/Mind_trick "Mind trick"),[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-12) as well as performing Force-enhanced jumps.[[69]](#cite_note-SW9-69)[[11]](#cite_note-Episode_V-11)[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-12) He also demonstrated the ability to have visions several times.[[48]](#cite_note-weapon-jedi-48)[[11]](#cite_note-Episode_V-11) Skywalker could disconnect himself from the Force, and he was able to renew his connection within a short amount of time.[[216]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Jedi-216)[[247]](#cite_note-TLJ:_Expanded_Edition-247) Luke Skywalker understood the dark side powers [mind probe](/wiki/Mind_probe_(Force_power) "Mind probe (Force power)"), Force-bond, and Force lightning well enough to write about them. On at least one occasion, he healed the bled kyber crystal from a Sith lightsaber.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7) He also studied [Force healing](/wiki/Force_healing "Force healing") and many esoteric Force powers.[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4)[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7) Snoke considered Skywalker to be very powerful and formidable and believed he would have taken over the galaxy quickly with Skywalker as his apprentice.[[244]](#cite_note-AOR_Snoke-244)

When using the force to restrain an archeologist possessed by a Sith spirit on Yoturba, Luke had to concentrate very carefully to restrain his power so that he did not accidentally kill the man. Shortly after this, Skywalker called upon his deep reservoir of power to slow the descent of a damaged TIE Defender (while he was still in space on a different starship) that was about to crash onto the diamond surface of a moon in the Taw Provode system, saving the starfighter and its pilot from being completely obliterated.[[7]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-7) When facing the Knights of Ren, Skywalker effortlessly Force-pushed the Knights of Ren and telekinetically disarmed and destroyed their weapons.[[233]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_2-233)

After the fall of Ben Solo and the destruction of his Jedi Temple, Skywalker spent years himself how to close himself off from the Force, an ability he considered much more difficult than reaching out to it in the first place.[[246]](#cite_note-TLJ_Adaptation_1-246) Shortly after reopening himself to the Force, Luke detected Rey and Ren's bond and in his anger, he Force pushed Rey's hut into pieces around the two and broke the connection. When defending himself against Rey, Luke pried an antenna from the roof of a hut and summoned it to himself in seconds, then managed to keep himself suspended off the ground after being knocked down by Rey. Whereas Ren noted that the effort of attempting [Force projection](/wiki/Force_projection "Force projection") would kill Rey, Skywalker was able to use the complete version of this ability; he gave all of himself into the Force, which allowed him to interact with others[[4]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-4) by sending a life-like image of himself across the galaxy to distract Kylo Ren and the First Order. The projection was so powerful that C-3PO acknowledged his presence, and Ren was tricked into believing it was the real him. Skywalker maintained it for a prolonged period of time, although the strain ultimately proved to be fatal and killed the Jedi Master.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

Skywalker was one of the few Jedi who was able to truly become one with the Force and preserve his consciousness as a [Force spirit](/wiki/Force_spirit "Force spirit"). As a Force spirit, Skywalker was able to physically interact with the living world, which he demonstrated when he caught the Skywalker lightsaber after Rey threw it, and when he lifted his X-wing from the oceans of Ahch-To and repaired it so that she could travel to Exegol.[[17]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-17)

### Other abilities

:   "*Luke is the best bush pilot in the Outer Rim Territories.*"
:   ―Biggs Darklighter boasts about Luke's piloting skills to Garven Dreis[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-1)

 [![Skywalker, whose father was considered the best pilot in the galaxy, flew the X-wing starfighter that destroyed the Death Star.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8f/X-Wing_Second_Edition_cover_art.png/revision/latest?cb=20180530052310) [![Skywalker, whose father was considered the best pilot in the galaxy, flew the X-wing starfighter that destroyed the Death Star.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8f/X-Wing_Second_Edition_cover_art.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/249?cb=20180530052310)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8f/X-Wing_Second_Edition_cover_art.png/revision/latest?cb=20180530052310) 

Skywalker, whose father was considered the best pilot in the galaxy, flew the X-wing starfighter that destroyed the Death Star.

 

Skywalker was acknowledged to be an expert pilot, being the person who was responsible for destroying the first Death Star and managing to evade Darth Vader himself (albeit with help from Han Solo).[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-1) He also managed to destroy an [Interdictor](/wiki/Interdictor "Interdictor") vessel on his own while piloting the *Desert Jewel*, although he acknowledged that R2-D2 saved him when the astromech droid made the ship jump into hyperspace in the nick of time.[[54]](#cite_note-HttJ-54) He was also able to pilot a Imperial Lambda-class T-4a shuttle with relative ease, outmaneuvering an [RZ-1 A-wing interceptor](/wiki/RZ-1_A-wing_interceptor "RZ-1 A-wing interceptor") that was trying to get a lock on him.[[198]](#cite_note-SE1-198) In fact, Skywalker had a talent for tinkering and a passion for speed.[[245]](#cite_note-TLJ:_A_Junior_Novel-245) With no previous experience, Skywalker was able to pilot a podracer with incredible skill, a feat that an announcer and Vader acknowledged was impressive.[[58]](#cite_note-SWA4-58) He was considered to be one of the Alliance's best pilots[[123]](#cite_note-SW_68-123) and gained recognition and fame amongst them for his skills because he made the shot that destroyed the Death Star.[[156]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_15_2020-156) He was able to pilot a shuttle into Cloud City and avoid the shots from its turret defenses though he worried he would get them killed.[[143]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_2-143) He briefly bested Vader in a dogfight over Jekara, tricking him into crashing.[[162]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_17_2020-162) His piloting and targeting skills were limited by his fear occasionally, and on one instance he missed a shot because he had a vision of Vader defeating Solo during the Battle of Yavin.[[156]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_15_2020-156)

He was even able to use a jetpack[[176]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_32-176) and was skilled with a speeder, once using one to take down an Imperial transport.[[128]](#cite_note-SW73-128) However, he once attempted to drive a boat and ended up capsizing it.[[147]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_5_2020-147) He also could perform environmental surveys, largely to due farming skills he gained from his time on Tatooine.[[102]](#cite_note-Storms_of_Crait-102)

He was a native speaker of [Galactic Basic Standard](/wiki/Galactic_Basic_Standard "Galactic Basic Standard"),[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-1) and although Skywalker could not understand [Shyriiwook](/wiki/Shyriiwook "Shyriiwook"), he had quickly learned how to read Chewbacca's moods by his tone and expression before the Battle of Yavin.[[6]](#cite_note-TPtSatFB-6) After decades of missions with R2, Skywalker was reasonably fluent in droidspeak.[[247]](#cite_note-TLJ:_Expanded_Edition-247)

Skywalker was adept in unarmed combat. He demonstrated his skill early on Cymoon 1 where he defeated a few stormtroopers by kicking and slamming them to the ground.[[14]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_1-14) Shortly afterwards he found himself being attacked by an entire mob full of alien thugs on Nar Shadaa. Skywalker defeated numerous of the attackers unarmed before igniting his lightsaber and startling the rest.[[68]](#cite_note-SW8-68) He found himself in another similar situation on Horox III, where he defeated an entire cantina of alien thugs with the help of Aphra and her Wookiee bounty hunter.[[89]](#cite_note-The_Screaming_Citadel_1-89) Skywalker knocked out the Commander Kanchar, a hulking cybernetic enhanced man with a single punch after outsmarting him.[[101]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_43-101) He was able to take down a muscled individual who was much larger than him using only a broom.[[123]](#cite_note-SW_68-123) However, Ellian Zahra was able to knock him down in an encounter where she was holding back, though he easily dodged her sword attack.[[150]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_8-150)

He was also capable with a blaster,[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-1) and could also escape ropes tied around his hands quickly, a skill Doctor Aphra theorized he learned from Han Solo.[[179]](#cite_note-Aphra_2020_32-179) It took him time to get used to fighting with a blaster and hand-to-hand with his prosthetic hand, however.[[142]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_1_2020-142) He was capable with a grappling hook and could use it to both swing[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-1) and pull items down.[[129]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_74-129) He also knew how to swim.[[107]](#cite_note-SW47-107)

In his later years, Skywalker displayed such skill that he was able to easily punch aside a Knight of Ren[[233]](#cite_note-Rise_of_Kylo_Ren_2-233) and disarm Rey of her quarterstaff before she could react.[[19]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-19)

## Equipment

### Lightsabers

:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main article: [Skywalker lightsaber](/wiki/Skywalker_lightsaber "Skywalker lightsaber")
:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main article: [Luke Skywalker's yellow lightsaber](/wiki/Luke_Skywalker%27s_yellow_lightsaber "Luke Skywalker's yellow lightsaber")
:   [![icon](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Blue_Glass_Arrow.svg/revision/latest?cb=20090726033133) Main article: [Luke Skywalker's green lightsaber](/wiki/Luke_Skywalker%27s_green_lightsaber "Luke Skywalker's green lightsaber")

[![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8e/Lightsaber_anakin_rots.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20060115213707)

Luke's lightsaber, used by his father before him.

[![](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/7d/LukeROTJsaber-MR.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100616172523)

Skywalker built a new lightsaber after losing his father's weapon.

Luke Skywalker wielded at least three lightsabers during the [Galactic Civil War](/wiki/Galactic_Civil_War "Galactic Civil War"). The first was his father's former weapon, that was retrieved and given to him by Obi-Wan Kenobi.[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-1) He wielded this weapon for three years before losing it, and the hand holding it, in a duel against Darth Vader on the cloud city on Bespin.[[11]](#cite_note-Episode_V-11)

The second one he obtained shortly after his visit to a Jedi outpost on Tempes. This saber was a lightsaber pike with only the still functional half of the lightsaber. Luke eventually fixed the damaged end and continued using this one to defend himself against foes like Commander Ellian Zahra.[[150]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_8-150) While in No-Space, this lightsaber was crushed and mangled by a killdroid. R2-D2 attempted to fix it, and while it still ignited, it often dangerously sputtered and crackled with energy.[[177]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_33-177) Dr. Cuata eventually repaired it.[[185]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_35-185)

Eventually, Skywalker built himself a new weapon, with a green blade, that he used to rescue his friends from Jabba the Hutt and during his final duel with Darth Vader.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-12)

He also briefly utilized one of [Darth Atrius' lightsabers](/wiki/Darth_Atrius%27_lightsabers "Darth Atrius' lightsabers"), but quickly destroyed it due to its effects on his mind.[[58]](#cite_note-SWA4-58)

### Blasters

Skywalker would carry several blasters. During his youth on [Tatooine](/wiki/Tatooine "Tatooine"), he had a [6-2Aug2 hunting rifle](/wiki/6-2Aug2_hunting_rifle "6-2Aug2 hunting rifle") when he went to search for R2 but it was destroyed when he was subsequently ambushed in the [Jundland Wastes](/wiki/Jundland_Wastes "Jundland Wastes") by the [Tusken Raider](/wiki/Tusken_Raider "Tusken Raider") [A'Koba](/wiki/A%27Koba "A'Koba"). While rescuing Leia from the Death Star, Luke used an [E-11 medium blaster rifle](/wiki/E-11_medium_blaster_rifle "E-11 medium blaster rifle"). During the Award ceremony that occurred shortly after the Battle of Yavin, Skywalker had a [Defender sporting blaster pistol](/wiki/Defender_sporting_blaster_pistol "Defender sporting blaster pistol").[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-1)He later owned a [heavy blaster pistol](/wiki/Heavy_blaster_pistol "Heavy blaster pistol") similar to a [DL-44](/wiki/DL-44_heavy_blaster_pistol "DL-44 heavy blaster pistol").[[11]](#cite_note-Episode_V-11)

## Behind the scenes

### Portrayal in the Skywalker Saga

#### Original trilogy

For most of his appearances in *[Star Wars saga](/wiki/Star_Wars_saga "Star Wars saga")*, Luke Skywalker was portrayed by actor [Mark Hamill](/wiki/Mark_Hamill "Mark Hamill").[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-1) For his appearance in [*Star Wars*: Episode III *Revenge of the Sith*](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Episode_III_Revenge_of_the_Sith "Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith"), Skywalker was portrayed as a infant by [Aidan Barton](/wiki/Aidan_Barton "Aidan Barton").[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13)

Luke Skywalker's character went through subsequent changes. In George Lucas' original script, Skywalker was meant to be called Luke Starkiller,[[268]](#cite_note-Empire_of_Dreams:_The_Story_of_the_Star_Wars_Trilogy-268) at one point the character was a girl,[[269]](#cite_note-The_Making_of_Star_Wars:_The_Definitive_Story_Behind_the_Original_Film-269) and Lucas even considered the main character to be a little person.[[270]](#cite_note-270) Luke Skywalker's first name is identical with George Lucas' high school nickname.[[271]](#cite_note-271) That Skywalker is urged by his uncle Owen Lars—who serves as the boy's father figure—to give up on his dreams and instead work in the family business, in his case moisture farming, can also be connected to Lucas' life, where his father George Lucas Sr. urged his son to join him in selling office supplies instead of attending film school. Furthermore, Skywalker also suffers great injuries throughout the saga,[[272]](#cite_note-Vanity_Battle-272) such as being attacked by a wampa and losing his hand in [*Star Wars*: Episode V *The Empire Strikes Back*](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Episode_V_The_Empire_Strikes_Back "Star Wars: Episode V The Empire Strikes Back") alone,[[11]](#cite_note-Episode_V-11) much as Lucas himself did in a 1962 car crash that almost killed the future director. The injuries suffered by Luke's father Anakin Skywalker can also be connected to Lucas' car crash. Lucas has indeed stated he put parts of himself into the characters of Anakin and Luke, reflecting that over his life he had wanted to be a Han Solo-like person, yet he instead found himself to be more of a Skywalker.[[272]](#cite_note-Vanity_Battle-272)

The draft script for the final entry of the original trilogy, what became [*Star Wars*: Episode VI *Return of the Jedi*](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Episode_VI_Return_of_the_Jedi "Star Wars: Episode VI Return of the Jedi"), had Luke fight the Emperor aboard Death Star II with the assistance of the Force spirits of both his masters, Obi-Wan Kenobi and Yoda. Skywalker would have been defended by both when Palpatine unleashed his Force lightning. Kenobi, Yoda, and Anakin Skywalker also returned to having physical forms in the script, allowing Luke to hug his resurrected father.[[273]](#cite_note-Rewind_of_the_Jedi-273) Skywalker's black costume in *Return of the Jedi* was intentionally designed to invoke Vader's also dark outfit.[[274]](#cite_note-Bantha_18-274)

#### Sequel trilogy

:   "*If you look at any classic hero's myth that is actually worth its salt, at the beginning of the hero's journey, like with King Arthur, he pulls the sword from the stone and he's ascendant — he has setbacks but he unites all the kingdoms. But then if you keep reading, when it deals with the hero's life as they get into middle-age and beyond, it always starts to get into darker places. And there's a reason for that: It's because myths are not made to sell action figures; myths are made to reflect the most difficult transitions we go through in life.*"
:   ―[Rian Johnson](/wiki/Rian_Johnson "Rian Johnson") on Luke's characterization in *The Last Jedi*[[275]](#cite_note-Hollywood_Reporter-275)

[George Lucas](/wiki/George_Lucas "George Lucas")'s [sequel trilogy](/wiki/Sequel_trilogy "Sequel trilogy") outline involved a Luke who had fallen into a dark state of mind, living in self-imposed exile in the first Jedi Temple. (He is described in [2013](/wiki/2013 "2013") concept art as "a [Colonel Kurtz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apocalypse_Now "wikipedia:Apocalypse Now") type.")[[276]](#cite_note-Art_of_TLJ-276) However, Lucas did not give a reason for Luke's change of attitude.[[277]](#cite_note-277) [Michael Arndt](/wiki/Michael_Arndt "Michael Arndt")'s initial script for *The Force Awakens* had Luke first appear halfway through the film, but Arndt came to feel that Luke's direct involvement would upstage Rey and the audience would cease caring about her. Ultimately, he, [J.J. Abrams](/wiki/J.J._Abrams "J.J. Abrams"), and [Lawrence Kasdan](/wiki/Lawrence_Kasdan "Lawrence Kasdan") agreed Luke would have to withdraw from the story and become a plot device instead.[[278]](#cite_note-278) Hamill still attended the cast's script reading, thereby concealing Luke's role, and was assigned to read the stage directions. "It was a way of having [him] be part of every scene, every moment, not just spiritually or thematically or narratively, but actually," Abrams said. "Having his voice in it made the read through a better experience for everyone."[[279]](#cite_note-279)

Hamill was initially concerned by how Luke was written in *The Last Jedi*. "I got into trouble because… I was quoted as saying to Rian [Johnson] that I fundamentally disagree with everything you decided about Luke, and it was inartfully [sic] phrased. What I was, was surprised at how he saw Luke. And it took me a while to get around to his way of thinking, but once I was there it was a thrilling experience. I hope it will be for the audience too."[[280]](#cite_note-280) Johnson explained: "Honestly, that came out of what I felt was a necessity, because it came from where he was at the end of *Episode VII, The Force Awakens*. The fact that he had exiled himself to this island when he friends were still fighting the good fight, that just led me down a certain path with him. I couldn't really see any other alternative.";[[281]](#cite_note-281) "Knowing that Luke is a hero, knowing Luke from growing up, I know he must think he's doing the right thing by taking himself out of the equation. And because he's the last Jedi, by taking the Jedi out of the equation, by saying, 'I'm taking the Jedi out of this fight,' he must think that's the best thing for the galaxy."[[282]](#cite_note-282) Hamill agreed that an old, comfortable Luke would have been too reminiscent of Obi-Wan, but his issue was that "'Jedis [sic] don't give up.'" Johnson added the back-and-forth to get Luke's character to make sense helped "made me really dig in and justify the choices I had made to bring Luke to where he was at. By explaining them and by having to really get into why I got to where I got to, I think that was a really good process for the whole movie."[[283]](#cite_note-283) To get into character, Hamill thought of the real life hopes and disappointments of [his generation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baby_boomers "wikipedia:Baby boomers").[[284]](#cite_note-284)

Johnson deemed it best to conclude Luke's *Last Jedi* arc with him dying partly because, "honestly, thinking about the number of characters we have on our plate going into the next movie [...] it just vaguely seemed good to me that putting Luke in another realm could open possibilities for his possible involvement in the next one. As opposed to him just being another character that had to be juggled into the plot, if that makes sense." He was unconcerned that the audience might feel unable to cope with Luke's death so soon after Han's murder in *The Force Awakens*, as Luke's passing was victorious and peaceful, not a violent defeat.[[285]](#cite_note-285) Hamill was particularly not keen on Luke dying, feeling he had to return a triumphant hero, but Johnson argued that "if Skywalker just came back like he did in the original trilogy, an optimistic fighter, he's just an older version of Rey. And Johnson needed someone to bounce up against Rey."[[286]](#cite_note-286) Hamill said his primary lesson from the experience was how, "At times, I'd say to Rian, 'We gotta think of what the audience wants,' "And he would say, 'No, we've gotta think of what we want.'"[[287]](#cite_note-287)

Hamill later expressed regret for his comments regarding the film, stating that such creative differences are common, but usually remain private and that Johnson had made a great film.[[288]](#cite_note-288) He later disclosed he had similarly disputed the way the character was written in *Return of the Jedi*, revealing "I read [the script for] Jedi and thought, 'Wait a sec! I thought I was heading toward the struggle of heading to the Dark Side. I'm in black. I have a glove. I see a trend here.'"[[289]](#cite_note-289)

*The Rise of Skywalker* reveals Luke and Leia knew about Rey's ancestry, despite the revelation not having been conceived during production of the previous two films. Co-writer [Chris Terrio](/wiki/Chris_Terrio "Chris Terrio") said, "This one I have to leave to the imagination of the viewer. But, I don't think it would be wrong to assume that Luke's Force Ghost would seek out his Force-sensitive, Jedi-trained sister."[[290]](#cite_note-290)

### Portrayal on Disney+

#### *The Mandalorian* and *The Book of Boba Fett*

In *[Star Wars: The Mandalorian](/wiki/Star_Wars:_The_Mandalorian "Star Wars: The Mandalorian")*'s "[Chapter 16: The Rescue](/wiki/Chapter_16:_The_Rescue "Chapter 16: The Rescue")," [Max Lloyd Jones](/wiki/Max_Lloyd-Jones "Max Lloyd-Jones") physically portrayed the character, with [Matt Rugetti](/wiki/Matt_Rugetti "Matt Rugetti") serving as a stunt double.[[18]](#cite_note-Chapter_16-18) Both Hamill and Jones were filmed—Jones with all of the cast, and Hamill when most of the cast and crew were filming outside of the studio. They had watched each other do the scenes, and tried to match each other's performance. [Lola's](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lola_Visual_Effects "wikipedia:Lola Visual Effects") digital [de-aging](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/De-aging_in_film "wikipedia:De-aging in film") was used to make the character look like young Luke Skywalker, and the voice was completely synthesised using an application called Respeecher. To prevent this appearance from leaking, the scripts had [Plo Koon](/wiki/Plo_Koon "Plo Koon") written instead of Luke Skywalker, and a concept art of Plo Koon destroying dark troopers was created.[[291]](#cite_note-Making_of_S2_Finale-291)

In *[Star Wars: The Book of Boba Fett](/wiki/Star_Wars:_The_Book_of_Boba_Fett "Star Wars: The Book of Boba Fett")*, [Graham Hamilton](/wiki/Graham_Hamilton "Graham Hamilton") was the performance artist for the character, with [Scott Lang](/wiki/Scott_Lang "Scott Lang") serving as a stunt double. The voice was artificially created with Respeecher.[[292]](#cite_note-Respeecher-292) [Rosario Dawson](/wiki/Rosario_Dawson "Rosario Dawson"), who played Ahsoka Tano in *The Book of Boba Fett*,[[229]](#cite_note-Comes_a_Stranger-229) didn't learn that her character would interact with Luke Skywalker until the day of filming. She was very excited that she got to work with Mark Hamill.[[293]](#cite_note-Rosario_Dawson_Tweet-293)

#### Portrayal in *Obi-Wan Kenobi*

:   "*And [Obi-Wan Kenobi] sees a guy in a dark robe with a red lightsaber, and he's like, 'Anakin, Anakin, Anakin!' And as… the guy in the robe comes up, he lifts his lightsaber, you see, it's Luke. Mark Hamill, 19. And so, Luke attacks him. Obi-Wan and Luke had this lightsaber battle in mine, which was mirroring, of course, Empire Strikes Back… so it was that kind of a thing that ends with, you know, Luke, just almost killing Obi-Wan, and Obi-Wan is snapping out of the, you know, the vision, basically, but it's a vision of the future if Obi-Wan keeps training Luke and putting all his guilt on this kid, Luke's gonna turn to the Dark Side.*"
:   ―Stuart Beattie describing the script for his Obi-Wan Kenobi feature film[[294]](#cite_note-Cody_Scrapped_Role-294)

In [Stuart Beattie](/wiki/Stuart_Beattie "Stuart Beattie")'s script for an Obi-Wan Kenobi feature film, when Kenobi left Tatooine, he left [clone trooper](/wiki/Clone_trooper "Clone trooper") [Cody](/wiki/Cody "Cody") in charge of Luke Skywalker, which was meant to be a side plot that the film would cut away to. Cody was planned as a way to show how disconnected Kenobi was from the Force due to forcing his will upon young Skywalker in a manner similar to when [Superman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superman_(1978_film_series_character) "wikipedia:Superman (1978 film series character)") lost his powers in the [1980](/wiki/1980 "1980") film [*Superman II*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superman_II "wikipedia:Superman II"). Kenobi would fall in with [refugees](/wiki/Refugee "Refugee") that are fleeing from the Empire. Tao, the lead refugee woman, took Kenobi to a sacred shrine and instructed the Jedi Master to let their goddess speak to him. Kenobi was then on Mustafar and was attacked by Luke Skywalker played by a de-aged Mark Hamill. Skywalker almost killed Kenobi, but he snapped out the vision and realized that putting his guilt on Skywalker would turn him to the dark side. Beattie was excited to be part of the first *[Star Wars](/wiki/Star_Wars "Star Wars")* project to bring back Skywalker.[[294]](#cite_note-Cody_Scrapped_Role-294)

 [![Grant Feely portrayed Luke Skywalker in Obi-Wan Kenobi](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/87/GrantFeely.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20220911200522) [![Grant Feely portrayed Luke Skywalker in Obi-Wan Kenobi](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/87/GrantFeely.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/160?cb=20220911200522)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/87/GrantFeely.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20220911200522) 

Grant Feely portrayed Luke Skywalker in *Obi-Wan Kenobi*

 

Skywalker was portrayed by [Grant Feely](/wiki/Grant_Feely "Grant Feely") as a young kid in [Part I](/wiki/Part_I "Part I"),[[26]](#cite_note-Part_I-26) [Part V](/wiki/Part_V "Part V"),[[29]](#cite_note-Part_V-29) and [Part VI](/wiki/Part_VI "Part VI") of the *[Star Wars: Obi-Wan Kenobi](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Obi-Wan_Kenobi "Star Wars: Obi-Wan Kenobi")* limited television series.[[30]](#cite_note-Part_VI-30) In [April](/wiki/April "April"), [2021](/wiki/2021 "2021"),[[295]](#cite_note-Rival-295) Feely's agent sent him the audition for a role.[[296]](#cite_note-Pix11_News-296) He then filmed an audition for "Boy - Untitled [Disney+](/wiki/Disney%2B "Disney+") Series," not knowing the role was for *Obi-Wan Kenobi*,[[295]](#cite_note-Rival-295) and he did not think anything of it.[[296]](#cite_note-Pix11_News-296) A week later, he had an hour-long [Zoom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zoom_Video_Communications "wikipedia:Zoom Video Communications") callback with [Carmen Cuba](/wiki/Carmen_Cuba "Carmen Cuba"), the casting director for the series. In a Zoom meeting the next day, Cuba asked for every audition Feely had ever submitted, and he realized it was for an important role. In early [June](/wiki/June "June"), he had a director's callback with director [Deborah Chow](/wiki/Deborah_Chow "Deborah Chow").[[295]](#cite_note-Rival-295) When he was in [Hawaii](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hawaii "wikipedia:Hawaii")[[296]](#cite_note-Pix11_News-296) during the end of June,[[295]](#cite_note-Rival-295) he was asked if he could come to [Los Angeles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Los_Angeles "wikipedia:Los Angeles"). He was not able to go, so they flew him to LA[[296]](#cite_note-Pix11_News-296) to do an in-person audition with Chow. In early [July](/wiki/July "July"), Chow called Feely to offer him the role of Luke Skywalker.[[295]](#cite_note-Rival-295) For about nine months, Feely kept his role a secret and only told his close family.[[297]](#cite_note-YoungEntMag-297)

Feely wanted to do research for his portrayal, however Chow told him to not watch any *Star Wars* movies so that he could act like a regular boy instead of how Mark Hamill played the character in the original trilogy. Chow explained that Skywalker does not learn about the Force until he's around twenty years old.[[296]](#cite_note-Pix11_News-296) He was not told anything about Skywalker or any other characters in the series.[[297]](#cite_note-YoungEntMag-297) When the rock scene[[295]](#cite_note-Rival-295) of Skywalker being chased by the [Inquisitor](/wiki/Inquisitor "Inquisitor") Reva[[30]](#cite_note-Part_VI-30) was being filmed, Feely was in a harness running along the top of the set.[[295]](#cite_note-Rival-295)

### Other appearances

In *[Episode IV: A New Hope Read-Along Storybook and CD](/wiki/A_New_Hope_Read-Along_Storybook_and_CD "A New Hope Read-Along Storybook and CD")*, Skywalker was voiced by [Joshua Fardon](/wiki/Joshua_Fardon "Joshua Fardon").[[298]](#cite_note-Read_Along-298) When he wrote the [2020](/wiki/2020 "2020") relaunch of the [mainline *Star Wars* comic](/wiki/Star_Wars_(2020) "Star Wars (2020)"), which was set between *The Empire Strikes Back* and *Return of the Jedi*, author [Charles Soule](/wiki/Charles_Soule "Charles Soule") knew that Skywalker's emotional journey between the events of both films was key factor in bridging their gap. In sculpting Skywalker's path between those movies, he found that one story arc,[[299]](#cite_note-Soule_Luke-299) the two issue *[The Sith and the Skywalker](/wiki/Star_Wars:_The_Sith_and_the_Skywalker "Star Wars: The Sith and the Skywalker")* storyline,[[300]](#cite_note-SW_2020_42-300)[[301]](#cite_note-SW_2020_43-301) was quite important to Skywalker's journey. Due to its importance, he was happy to see fans enjoy it.[[299]](#cite_note-Soule_Luke-299)

### *Trials on Tatooine*

:   "*Good luck with whatever Luke has you doing down here.*"
:   ―Han Solo to Skywalker's student about Luke[[302]](#cite_note-Trials_on_Tatooine-302)

In the cinematic virtual-reality game, *[Star Wars: Trials on Tatooine](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Trials_on_Tatooine "Star Wars: Trials on Tatooine")*, after Skywalker had many journeys to the distant corners of the galaxy, uncovering secrets about the legacy of the Jedi, he felt ready to create a new Jedi Order. He took on a [padawan learner](/wiki/Unidentified_hopeful_Padawan "Unidentified hopeful Padawan"), who was hoping to join the Jedi Order, and sent the Padawan on a [mission](/wiki/Mission_to_Tatooine_(Hopeful_Padawan) "Mission to Tatooine (Hopeful Padawan)") to Tatooine to await a delivery from Han Solo. The *Millennium Falcon* landed, and R2-D2 handed the Padawan a lightsaber. However, remnants of the Galactic Empire began an operation to attack the Padawan.[[302]](#cite_note-Trials_on_Tatooine-302)

### Role in LEGO *Star Wars*

#### LEGO animated series

:   "*Rowan, May the Force be With You.*"
:   ―Luke Skywalker to Rowan Freemaker after their first meeting[[303]](#cite_note-Crossing_Paths-303)

 [![Luke Skywalker as depicted in The Freemaker Adventures](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d2/Luke_Freemaker_Adventures.png/revision/latest?cb=20170917020846) [![Luke Skywalker as depicted in The Freemaker Adventures](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d2/Luke_Freemaker_Adventures.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/100?cb=20170917020846)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d2/Luke_Freemaker_Adventures.png/revision/latest?cb=20170917020846) 

Luke Skywalker as depicted in *The Freemaker Adventures*

 

Even though Skywalker's appearances in various [LEGO *Star Wars*](/wiki/LEGO_Star_Wars "LEGO Star Wars") content are not a part of the official *Star Wars* [canon](/wiki/Canon "Canon"), they are set in a unique, continuous universe.[[304]](#cite_note-IGN-304) In the *LEGO Star Wars* television series *[LEGO Star Wars: The Freemaker Adventures](/wiki/LEGO_Star_Wars:_The_Freemaker_Adventures "LEGO Star Wars: The Freemaker Adventures")*, Skywalker was often alluded to, but the man himself only made three physical appearances: the episodes "[Crossing Paths](/wiki/Crossing_Paths "Crossing Paths"),"[[303]](#cite_note-Crossing_Paths-303) "[Trouble on Tibalt](/wiki/Trouble_on_Tibalt "Trouble on Tibalt"),"[[305]](#cite_note-TOT-305) and "[Return of the Return of the Jedi](/wiki/Return_of_the_Return_of_the_Jedi "Return of the Return of the Jedi"),"[[306]](#cite_note-ROROTJ-306) where he was voiced by [Eric Bauza](/wiki/Eric_Bauza "Eric Bauza").[[303]](#cite_note-Crossing_Paths-303)

Skywalker also made appearance[[307]](#cite_note-Exit_from_Endor-307) in the five-episode limited series *[LEGO Star Wars: Droid Tales](/wiki/LEGO_Star_Wars:_Droid_Tales "LEGO Star Wars: Droid Tales")*, a series that re-told the story of the live-action *Star Wars* films, from [*Star Wars*: Episode I *The Phantom Menace*](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Episode_I_The_Phantom_Menace "Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace") through *Star Wars*: Episode VI *Return of the Jedi*, albeit in a rather silly and exaggerated fashion, as well as a similarly-portrayed adaptation of the *[Star Wars Rebels](/wiki/Star_Wars_Rebels "Star Wars Rebels")* episode "[Droids in Distress](/wiki/Droids_in_Distress "Droids in Distress")."[[308]](#cite_note-SeriesAnnouncement-308) Skywalker was once again voiced by Eric Bauza in the series.[[307]](#cite_note-Exit_from_Endor-307)

#### LEGO video games

 [![LEGO Luke Skywalker at the end of LEGO Star Wars: The Force Awakens](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/24/LEGO_Luke_Ahch-To.png/revision/latest?cb=20200205031347) [![LEGO Luke Skywalker at the end of LEGO Star Wars: The Force Awakens](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/24/LEGO_Luke_Ahch-To.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/100?cb=20200205031347)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/24/LEGO_Luke_Ahch-To.png/revision/latest?cb=20200205031347) 

LEGO Luke Skywalker at the end of *LEGO Star Wars: The Force Awakens*

 

For the *[LEGO Star Wars: The Force Awakens](/wiki/LEGO_Star_Wars:_The_Force_Awakens "LEGO Star Wars: The Force Awakens")* [video game](/wiki/Star_Wars_video_games "Star Wars video games"), Mark Hamill reprised his role as Skywalker, albeit through archive footage and not newly-recorded dialogue.[[309]](#cite_note-LEGO_TFA-309) In *[LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga](/wiki/LEGO_Star_Wars:_The_Skywalker_Saga "LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga")*, he was voiced by [David Menkin](/wiki/David_Menkin "David Menkin"), who was overjoyed to play the iconic character.[[310]](#cite_note-David_Twitter-310) In this game, Skywalker is presented as having tried to deal with the rising darkness of Ben Solo during the time of the Jedi academy in a calm and non-threatening way, only drawing his lightsaber to block an attack from the younger man.[[311]](#cite_note-LEGO_Skywalker_Saga-311)
